content.content: Key Info Name: Flip Flop Flap Delegate LLC Delegate Contract: 0x0f4Be9f208C552A6b04d9A1222F385785f95beAA Delegate Address:  3FDelegate.eth (0x26f41D791733ad797dc65Ff05a4080AE7ec7C481) Forum: @flipflopflapdelegate Email: [email protected] Meet Your Delegate Video: Announcing MakerDAO Delegate: Flip Flop Flap Delegate LLC - YouTube Core Values  Delegate as the Voice and Vision of the Maker Community and its Core Units. Continue my loyalty and love for the Maker Community by making myself available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week–I will be here, ready, willing, and able. Prioritize the achievements and future success of MakerDAO. Help the Maker Community to expand its network effects.  Delegate Statement For the last 30+ months I have been one of the top 10 MakerDAO Voters. I have probably voted over 150+ times with my MKR tokens. And this passion and focus for Maker Governance has been inspired by All of you, and I mean every  single one of you. Yes, you have inspired me and help me follow this passion and mission to make DAI the ultimate decentralized stablecoin. It’s a passion that we share–the passion of Maker+DAI changing the world. The dream of making DAI the standard of Decentralized Finance. My Ethereum Address with its small portion of MKR might have never carried every Poll and Executive Vote, but thru it all I have always help protect the Hat and I have never let high ETH Gas Prices deter me from voicing my opinion and protecting this protocol. My love for the community and passion for MakerDAO is more important than any ETH gas I have spent. And that commitment and love my Maker Fam, it will never diminish. I want to be your MKR Delegate because I believe in you. I believe in your passion. I believe and share your dreams. I believe in a fully decentralized DAO composed of community members that are loyal, responsible, and innovative. Community members who want the same success that Maker has achieved today and the greatness that it will achieve tomorrow. This is why—when I was asked to join a Working Group to help compose MIP38 DAO Primitives State, MIP39 Core Unit Framework, MIP40 Budget Framework, and MIP41 Facilitator Framework, I did not hesitate. I did not have any Fear. Because this is my passion. This is our home. And protect and build our home is what we do as MKR token holders. Maker Community, I want to represent your Voice. I want to represent your Vision. Yes, I promise to protect MakerDAO from the Fear of innovating, the Fear of pivoting if needed, the Fear of never reaching decentralization, and the fear of governance attacks. I will do this by listening to your believes, your scientific governance theories, and following the path and vision of the Maker Community and its original vision. That same vision that was put together years ago by a community of Finance Nerds who had the hunger and the passion for changing the status quo. I will protect our Maker ways by inspiring my Delegate colleagues to unite and protect the protocol from any outside attackers, and/or attack vectors. We will work together, follow common grounds and stay diligent. At times, you and I might have had different opinions. Some opinions were probably similar, others were misconstrued because communication in writing can be misinterpreted. Other times, some of you were too busy to participate and voice your opinion. And then there were some of you who wanted to participate but felt your MKR holdings were not going to make a difference. Well, I am here to tell you that you will no longer be unnoticed. You will no longer be unheard. You will no longer need to attend every meeting, read every Forum Post, review every MIP application–I will represent you. I will be your voice; I will be your eyes and ears–and you will be the heartbeat of Maker Governance. The pulse of the community will not go unnoticed. It is because we share this common passion that I ask that you delegate your MKR to Flip Flop Flap Delegate. I promised to respect your views and listen to your concerns. I promised to explain why I voted for Polls and Executives and if you disagree with such vote, I will make time to listen to you and hold your hand as we both shape and build this DAO, together as one. Conflicts of Interest  At times I might buy, sell, or hold other Crypto Tokens for short & long-term trading purposes.  I have read and agree to abide by the Delegate Code of Conduct.  Waiver of liability By delegating to Flip Flop Flap Delegate LLC, you acknowledge and agree that Flip Flop Flap Delegate LLC, will participate on a best efforts basis and will not be liable for any form of damages related to participation in the Maker Protocol, or MakerDAO.

content.content: Consolidating the Current Polls and Executive Vote  for the week of August 9, 2021 from a VLOG Forum Post to my Delegate Platform: [Delegate VLOG] Flip Flop Flap Delegate MKR Vote

content.content: Current Polls for August 16, 2021 Governance Poll: Onboarding PAX Peg Stability Module - August 16, 2021 Voted Yessss—for one, the Growth CU team has work relentlessly to make this deal come into fruition. I fully support their vision and desire to grow the supply of DAI. This will also diversify DAI collateral and provide some comfort to those that worry about the Maker’s exposure to USDC. Governance Poll: Reduce Vault Liquidation Ratios - August 16, 2021 Voted Yessss—The Risk CU posted an analysis on decreasing liquidation ratios and the Community did not object. Using their Risk Models, the ratios were battled tested, and I believe this is the right approach. I do hope that eventually the Maker protocol will be compensated a bit more for all the Risk it takes. Community Greenlight Poll: CNC1-DROP (CapitalNow Cannabis DROP) - August 16, 2021 Voted Yes—this company has underwritten over 85,000 transactions and has 13 years’ experience in this field. You couple that with the fact that that more American voters and state legislatures support the approval of either medicinal, or adult recreational use of cannabis—I believe this is a sector Maker should consider. Governance Poll: NCP01-DROP (Nebula Capital Partners DROP) - August 16, 2021 Voted Yes—if you didn’t get a chance to watch the Collateral Onboarding Call with Nebula and the folks from Tinka I strongly recommend you do! Impressive Teams, and a promising product (Tinka)—this as I like to say, is a no-brainer. Not to mention that NCP has Skin in the Game! Community Greenlight Poll:  CGFF-DROP (Cauris Global Fintech Fund DROP) - August 16, 2021 Voted Yes—another RWA candidate that will have skin in the game as they will invest in a significant amount of the TIN tranche to show confidence in the pool via a “Debt Venture Fund”. They are also on a mission to close the gap on financial inclusion for medium and small businesses. I believe this is where MakerDAO can showcase its goodness and love for humanity.

content.content: Executive Proposals Vault Onboarding, 6s Updates, and Reducing Vault Liquidation Ratios - August 20, 2021 The long-awaited debut of the 6S RWA DC increase is now here and I believe the community will vote “Yes” and pass this Executive with flying colours. It’s been a long road for 6S Capital, as they patiently orchestrated their quest to becoming Maker’s first Delaware Statutory Trust structure for RWAs. Looking forward to following developments closely and voting on future LendCo’s that follow the same path. The Risk Core Unit presented the community with an analysis for decreasing LR only for second tier vault types by 10%, and decreasing LR for leading vaults. The community, including myself did not have any objections, as most of us believe this is a positive in case of a Market drawdown (particularly ETH) – Vault owners will appreciate the lower LR. The community opine via a Signal Request that the PSM-USDC-A Fee-In (tin) will be increased from 0.1% to 0.2%. I agree–and believe that this tool is an important backstop for controlling the DAI peg.

content.content: Active Polls 2 Polls - Ending September 2, 2021, 16:00 UTC Lower the Flash Mint Fee (toll) to 0% - August 30, 2021 Signal Request created by @hexonaut  showcases in my opinion, as well as the majority of the community opinion–that lowering the toll to 0 provides benefits to attract more usage of the module. Voted, “Yes.” Add RWA007 (SolarX) as a new RWA Vault Type In what I personally consider an early probationary period for Recognized Delegates, this in my opinion has been our toughest Poll since seeking tenure as a MakerDAO Delegate. Its comprehensible that Delegates and most of the Maker Community lack, or retain a background/experience in Project Finance. Therefore, I believe its my responsibility as a Delegate to put in the time and effort to investigate as much as possible–the “dealings” pertaining to this collateral type, and also rely on the much needed guidance of our RWF CU. After numerous hours of reading, researching, and asking questions–I believe that this project has infinitesimal downside and a much greater upside. While no business wants to lose 3,285,000 DAI–Delegates and the Maker community expect SolarX @Andy.SolarX to provide a Trust Structure that is acceptable to MKR token holders, before this MIP6 Application goes to an Executive Vote. Voted, “Yes”.

content.content: Executive Proposals Parameter Changes, September Core Unit Budgets, DssVest Streams - September 3, 2021 You love to see it–Executive goes up on a Friday evening, and you wake on a Monday morning to see it executed. What could be better then that?   The Flash Mint Fee (toll) will be decreased from 0.05% to 0%. The PSM-PAX-A Debt Ceiling will be increased from 50 million DAI to 500 million DAI. 2 million DAI will be distributed to the DAI Foundation Reserves Backup Wallet. 138,591 DAI will be distributed to the DAI Foundation Operational Wallet. 155,237 DAI will be distributed to the Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling Auditors’ Wallet.  Excited to see inception of the DAI Foundation kickstart a long everlasting representation of what DAI stands for–bringing a lot of goodness to the world. You couple that with some parameter changes that I believe will help expand the utility of DAI, and necessary funding for SES growth, this was a “Yes” vote that needed to be placed on a Friday evening.

Active Polls 2 POLLS - ENDING SEP 20, 2021, 16:00 UTC  Community Greenlight Poll - RARE (SuperRare) - September 6, 2021 The protocol went live around April of 2018. Since then they have put in a lot of work and thought into how ART should be represented via NFTs. They have an aim to incorporate NFTs into VR/AR, etc., and the issuance of this DAO Governance token allows SuperRare to follow the path of decentralization.   Voted “Yes” and I look forward to learning more about the mechanics behind RARE.  Community Greenlight Poll - RAI (Rai Reflex Index) - September 6, 2021 IMO RAI is an asset that can provide Maker another collateral type that allows it to Pivot from centralized stablecoins, and inject exposure to ETH and in the future, stakedETH. Voted “Yes” and I am looking forward for our Core Units assessments of such.

Really excited to see this develop. Add GUNIV3DAIUSDC1-A as a new Vault Type - September 13, 2021 Voted “Yes”, adding the G-UNI LP token (DAI/USDC) is a great option that will provide value to the protocol and allow Maker users to benefit from the compounding effect provided from the Uniswap v3 LP fees. Offboard KNC Legacy Token - September 13, 2021 Voted, “Yes” – In my opinion, the Kyber folks have their hands-full with their own incentive program based on the new KNC Token, and at this stage they don’t have an interest in including DAI in their plans. With only 5 remaining Maker vaults using the KNC-A vault, its best to offboard.  Active Polls 8 POLLS - ENDING SEP 27, 2021, 16:00 UTC Ratification Poll for RWA Foundations (MIP58) - September 13, 2021 Voted “Abstain” – I believe the community needs a third party legal opinion for the upside and downside of using this structure. That is evident in the Informal Poll that resulted in 44% of the community Abstaining. I myself polled yes in the informal poll, but after thinking it over, I request for more information from both the RWF CU and a third-party expert–on how this tool/structure can be used properly, and what are the downsides and upsides of such. Ratification Poll for Strategic Happiness Core Unit, SH-001 - September 13, 2021 Voted “Yes” – A Core Unit with an agenda to spread love–what can be better then that! Ratification Poll for Development & UX Core Unit, DUX-001 - September 13, 2021 Voted “Yes”, I am really excited to have the DUX CU onboarded, much needed and super talented team. Ratification Poll for StarkNet Engineering Core Unit, SNE-001 - September 13, 2021 Voted, “Yes” – I have ask some tough questions and StarkNet has been kind enough to produce responses-- much appreciated. I want to see this develop and I believe most of the community does as well. However, I do think there might be more questions left that I have not asked, and Both the community and Delegates should ask. This is an exciting new opportunity with challenges, but with challenges, there is also an opportunity. Ratification Poll for Collateral Engineering Services Core Unit, CES-001 - September 13, 2021 Voted, “Yes”–This is a resilient CU that has iterated on their mission and I believe they will bring in a fresh perspective, as well as new contributors to the MakerDAO ecosystem. Ratification Poll for Modify Core Unit Budget - Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling (MIP40c3-SP31) - September 13, 2021 Voted “Yes” – Much needed funding for SES as the incubation programs continues to grow, as grants are coming online. Ratification Poll for Risk Core Unit MKR Compensation (MIP40c3-SP25) - September 13, 2021 Voted “Yes” – The retroactive MKR compensation is well deserve by Primoz and Marko–how many people are willing to perform and not get properly compensated–especially in crypto? Not many. This is well deserve along with the MKR compensation plan. Ratification Poll for GovAlpha Core Unit Budget Q4 2021 to Q1 2022 (MIP40c3-SP29) - September 13, 2021 Voted “Yes” – The GovAlpha has been working relentless to improve upon the community experience via SourceCred, the Voter experience via the DUX CU, while handing a ton of other responsibilities. content.content: Executive Proposals Off-boarding Vaults, MKR Vesting, and Core Unit Budget Distribution - October 8, 2021 Voted, “Yes” and here’s why: Offboard the BAT-A Vault Type Besides what I stated in my last post above—whenever I think of BAT I remember Rocket.Chat conversations I had with community members who felt BAT had a better opportunity for growth if they had pegged their token to DAI. It’s not necessarily why I voted yes, but IMO the utility of this token has waned. I can’t remember the last anybody has brought-up BAT in a crypto related conversation. Another factor—most BAT token hodlers can’t afford to open a Vault, as the dust parameters are 10K DAI. Offboard the LRC-A Vault Type Besides the reasons Instated above, IMO the Loopring community is more focus on building their protocol via incentives  that favors the dedicated layer 2 LRC user. Hence, I believe their focus is not on leveraging L1 but more in keeping their protocol as the main focus. Offboard the UNIV2AAVEETH-A The utility of AAVE as a staking/governance token, plus the fact that most DeFi users are now smart enough to recognize and understand that impermanent loss is real — has taken a bite-out of this Uniswap LP token. Plus you add the fact that even Avalanche partnership is offering incentives for AAVE token holders—the appetite for this LP token is non-existent, IMO. Offboard the ZRX-A Vault Type The OG of DeFi — sad to see this one get off-boarded, but as Rema of the Risk CU team stated, “ We are currently subsidising these vault types because the stability fee is set to 3% and 4% respectively, while our calculated risk premium is at 16.8% and 30%.”  I also admired that Decentraland (MANA) came out and communicated to our community that they wanted to help their token scale via the MANA-A Vault Type. I think some of us would have liked to have seen the same from the ZRX community… Offboard the UNIV2LINKETH-A Vault Type As we All know the majority of LINK tokens are in the hands of folks that probably do not include MakerDAO in their Christmas list. Although many moons ago I voted to onboard this collateral type, I never felt confident that it would blossom. That feeling was mutual as the community overwhelmingly polled to off-board this Vault Type. RISK-001 MKR Vesting Stream a well deserved compensation for two Risk CU teammates that have done a superb job on-behalf of MakerDAO—thank you! Distribute Initial CES-001 Core Unit Budget super excited to see Rojo and the new CES Cu team reel in some new talent to and provide the extra technical services this DAO needs.

None

content.content: RE-VOTE: Active Polls: PaperImperium Supplemental Compensation - October 11, 2021 After further consideration and soul searching, I have concluded that it is in the best interest of the Maker community for Flip Flop Flap Delegate LLC to Abstain from deciding compensation for fellow delegate, PaperImperium. I do not believe it is appropriate for delegates to determine one other’s compensation. Compensation must be handled in a way that treats all delegates equally and on the same terms. I apologize to the Maker Community for not following my original intuition to Abstain from this decision, my original position on this Poll. It is the belief of Flip Flop Flap Delegate that the Maker Community must reach a collective consensus on how Delegates are to be compensated.

content.content: flipflopflapdelegate:  I do not believe it is appropriate for delegates to determine one other’s compensation. Compensation must be handled in a way that treats all delegates equally and on the same terms.   Not that I have any issue with the abstention but I would like to point out that there are two separate things to consider here:   @PaperImperium’s work as a delegate His work as a community member.  The compensation being voted on now is for item 2. It should not matter that he also happens to be a delegate. Unfortunately, I find that this was not sufficiently emphasized, even in the original signal request thread. I think it is important to make this sort of thing more clear and I hope Paper joins in making these lines less blurry. We all benefit from clarity on what compensation is for what work.

content.content: I agree, and anyway I am skeptical of delegates abstaining on delegation-related votes. I think the specific way delegation works means we don’t need delegates to abstain. In a traditional setting you could vote yourself a high salary and nobody could do anything for X years. With delegation voting power can be instantly taken away, and decisions like that can be mostly reverted. It also doesn’t sound very realistic to have delegates not vote on an executive. Does it have a chance to pass in a reasonable timeframe without them? I’d be interested in arguments about why it is in fact not appropriate for delegates to vote delegation-related things – it is for sure an important topic.

content.content: Active Polls 6 POLLS - ENDING OCT 25 2021 12:00 GMT-4 Ratification Poll for Growth Core Unit Budget, GRO-001 (MIP40c3-SP37) - October 11, 2021 Voted “Yes” – for the continuation of support for the Growth CU and their quest to expand the DAI supply across the stablecoin spectrum. Also, the new hiring of Corina as Project Manager is a plus, as the team is laser focused on expanding campaigns with current partners. Ratification Poll for Adding the Deco Fixed Rate Core Unit (DECO-001) - October 11, 2021 Voted “Yes” – Deco is a platform that allows Maker to set/control the rates for Fixed Yields, and its designed by a former Maker Engineer (some might say a Maker OG) @vamsi – who IMO is top tier talent and I believe most MKR holders should want and love to see veterans like him continue to contribute. It is aligned with the right incentives, as this core unit is proposed on standard compensation terms and profit share will kick-in if Deco is successful. I am also excited to see Deco used as a test-case within project Sandbox. Ratification Poll for Modify Core Unit Budget, MKT-001 (MIP40c3-SP33) - October 11, 2021 Voted “Yes” – it is vital that we support our Core Units. It is extremely important that our Team members sleep well at night knowing that MKR token holders support their efforts, and understand that their comfort via Job Security will equal productive and positive-sum results. And yes, this CU needs to modify their budget – but think about the stress that this mishap has put on the entire team. One thing we All must remember is that the blockchain is an open book. The DAI streamed to All the Core Units is available for you and I to check via the Makerburn Accounting Dashboard. And yes, they are “under budget”. But let’s not forget that the Content Core Unit has not been operating for that long. And when an entrepreneur starts a new business the most comforting resource is having excess capital that ensures versus an unexpected expense, or scaling the business by hiring new team members (Content CU is in the midst of doing such). More importantly–let’s be honest–the DAI is still in their multi-sig and there has never been a sign of them behaving maliciously. On a weekend where PECU delivered and amazing feat of MakerDAO strength and goodness– by helping an end-user recover their ETH–I support our Core Units, and therefore I Vote YES to the @Content-Production budget. content.content: Executive Proposals  Onboarding WBTC-B, Increasing WBTC-A Stability Fee, Change of Covenants for P1-DROP, Offboarding Collaterals - November 19, 2021. Voted, “Yes” on the following items:   The rapid growth of WBTC has been impressive and we believe it will continue to scale to DeFi via most of the active cross-chains. With over 75% of the BTC on Ethereum currently being composed of WBTC, we believe a type-B collateral type of WBTC will attract more minting of DAI.   We support the increase of 150 basis points to WBTC-A, as readings of the usability of this Collateral Type have increased in recent months. Ongoing popularity of BTC within DeFi will remain strong as inflation expectations remain sky-high.   As stated in our previous comments, we are in support of off-boarding the aforementioned collateral types.   Previously Voted, “No” on the following item:  We are supporters of the American Heartland and the folks who are the unsung heroes of the economy, Farmers. However, the covenant changes were in our believe requested without a provided written opinion from Sherman & Sterling on the current legal structure. Therefore, we believe we have acted in the best interest of MakerDAO when rejecting the covenant changes. In the grand scheme of things, indeed the requested amount for an increase in acquisition price from $1.5 million to $2.85 million is small, but not as important as the principle of keeping MakerDAO safe.

content.content: Active Polls Kicking-off 2022 5 POLLS - ENDING JAN 13 2022 16:00 UTC  Prioritize Onboarding a Compound DAI Direct Deposit Module (D3M) - January 10, 2022 Voted Yes – as we start the new year with an active poll for one of Maker’s most exciting modules, the D3M. Coming off its successful 2021 run, the D3M is now being proposed as an expansion tool for Compound.finance, a platform that currently has DAI as their #1 most active stablecoin ahead of USDC. Compound can be defined as a conservative platform with over 19,000++ suppliers of DAI, that currently earn COMP governance tokens at a rate of 90 basis points per annum. We believe the R/R ratio is optimal, as the D3M can help build and further strengthen the relationship with the Compound community.  Prioritize DAI Direct Deposit Module (D3M) for Maple Finance - January 10, 2022 Voted Yes – we are supporting the Signal Request for the Maple DAI pool via the D3M with the understanding that key players in both the RWF CU & Growth CU teams have already been actively in-talks with the Maple team and will create a Sandbox design that will incorporate a trial-run at small scale, with the final goal to implement a legal structure for the benefit of MakerDAO. We also request feedback with regards to Maker earning MPL farming rewards, and request further details of the technical challenges.  We believe accumulating MPL within the Maker Treasury will be beneficial to the Maple community, and allow this DAO to participate and help govern the future of Maple Finance.  Raise the Emergency Shutdown Module (ESM) Threshold - January 10, 2022 Voted Yes – as Flip Flop Flap Delegate along with the Community have been proponents of raising the ESM threshold to 100,000 MKR since April, 2021. Long overdue as the community had favorably signaled to increase it to 100K back then.  Increase the Dust Parameter for Select LP Token Vaults - January 10, 2022 Voted Yes – with the continue success of Eth Gas Guzzlers like OpenSea (  $2.1B in sales in the first 10 days of 2022) Uniswap, and as of today, LooksRare–we believe liquidating LP tokens will continue to be an expensive endeavor. Raising the Dust Parameters helps protect MakerDAO from risk of vaults being too small to liquidate at a profit. With that in mind, if this Poll garners enough votes via an Executive Vote, we ask the responsible actors to communicate to the public that the Debt Floor has been raised.  Proposal - Recover DAI Locked in Optimism Escrow - January 10, 2022 Voted Yes – with the positive response by the community to help this individual recover her, or his DAI, it leads us to believe that the Maker Community wants to do the right thing and send a signal to the DeFi ecosystem that the Maker community is composed of long-term players, playing in a long-term game. We believe this act-of-kindness will one day be paid back to the community in spades. We also believe this is an honest-human-mistake that can be made by anybody and this individual has warranted the full-support of some key players within the MakerDAO community. We hope to see the day that All individuals are able to recover their lost funds via an automated process that will be recorded like this one, on-chain.

content.content: Executive Proposals  Recover DAI from Optimism Escrow, Changes to Uniswap LP Vault Debt Floor Parameters, Delegate Compensation - January 14, 2022 Voted YES – First Executive Proposal of the new year and as all-executives this has a variety of topics. The first covers the Recovery of DAI from Optimism, a well discussed Signal Request that was widely debated by the Maker Community. An overwhelming majority of community members want to see the DAO implement a recovery fo DAI policy. We agree and felt that this is good opportunity to help a DAI user recover funds that seem to have been mistakenly burned on Optimism. For more details please visit this post by one of the PECU team members. The second topic at hand focuses around raising the Debt Floor parameters for Uni LP tokens. Such tokens require higher gas costs to liquidate which leads to a lesser buffer for liquidations. We fully support the increase of the Dust/Debt floor. And last but not least, the continuation of the Delegate compensation trial is fully supported as we have witness and increase dialogue and participation within delegates, as we All debate and discuss respectively all of the pending issues at hand. We believe we have a good group of folks that have strong opinions and willingness to push this DAO forward.

content.content: Community Greenlight Poll - OGN (Origin Protocol) - January 10, 2022 Voted YES and here’s why:  This is an impressive team with a nice background (some are former YouTube employees) Yes, Origin has yet to scale to its full potential, but the Platform has pivoted to the NFT space and recently held a very successful sale. DEX liquidity is minimal, most of the liquidity exist in CEXs–we urge @joshfraser @coleman to look to expand DEX liquidity–otherwise this MIP6 application will not make it too far–Core Unit teams will reject it. It is expensive for Maker to onboard ilks and as well for both Oracle and Keepers to manage. We believe Origin is an attractive “takeover” candidate (speculation & Not Financial Advice) for anybody looking to enter this ecosystem. Origin treasury rivals MakerDAO (at times surpasses it) at $280M  We believe this collateral type garners a high-stability fee in order to recoup cost associated with maintenance and for the urn to be profitable However, this is a “greenlight” poll and the assessments from Maker Core Units could be unfavorable.   Community Greenlight Poll - OUSD (Origin Dollar) - January 10, 2022 Voted NO to Greenlighting as we continue to see a decent slippage, included in Curve which provides the best avenue for liquidity. We couple that with the exposure to USDT and we believe a PSM for OUSD is not favorable. However, we do encourage the Origin team to open dialogue with the Growth Core Unit about how a OUSD PSM can help scale DAI, and what parameters the Origin Community is willing to accept.  Community Greenlight Poll - TUSD-PSM (TrueUSD) - January 10, 2022 Voted NO to Greenlighting this MIP6 as the Maker Community was rattled by an Actor believed to be connected to TruFi borrowed up to 40,000 MKR from Aave. Such actions can be interpreted as a Governance Attack and we believe that if the accusations are indeed valid, a reasoning behind such move should be posted. Although–some might say that it is fair-game. Note that some community members would have considered a PSM for TUSD, therefore we encourage the TruFi team to communicate their intentions more openly to the Maker community.  Community Greenlight Poll - USDap (BondAppetit) - January 10, 2022 Voted NO – there is uncertainty when it comes to swapping USDap to DAI (liquidity is hard to find) and we recently came across the former CTO of BondAppetit who has now moved on to build DeFiHelper. So, we wonder where this team stands and how do they will fix their issues with regards to an unstable stablecoin:  image1660×722 63.3 KB   Ratification Poll for Offboarding Content Production Core Unit (MKT-001) - January 10, 2022 Voted YES – please see Delegate Pre-Vote Notice

content.content: Active Polls 2 POLLS - ENDING FEB 07 2022 16:00 UTC  Community Greenlight Poll - STABLE-NOTE (2 to 10 Year Duration US Treasury Securities) - January 24, 2022 Voted NO – we believe this euphonious idea requires the fiduciary duty of an Arranger with years of Treasury Management experience. As the MIP6 applicant GFX knows, purchasing US Treasury Securities requires more than just using TreasuryDirect–it will require MakerDAO’s investment considerations (risk & liquidity needs), methods of evaluating risk, experience in understanding the Yield Curve, analysis for extending duration, and previous life-exposure to handling rate shocks. And although this MIP6 applications only pertains to US Treasury Securities, we would prefer to support an Arranger who also has experience with other types of sovereign government bonds. After all, Maker is a global DAO. From the recent methodologies for RWAs, we believe that if this application was review by the incoming RWF teams it would not meet the historical management background and methodology necessary to recommend this MIP6 to be onboarded. However, we say thank you to GFX for bringing this idea to light.  Community Greenlight Poll - STABLE-TBILL (US Treasury Securities Up To 12 Months Duration) - January 24, 2022 Voted NO – please see reasons above.

Executive Proposals  Temporarily Prevent Surplus (flap) Auctions and MKR Burn - January 24, 2022 Voted YES to one of our favourite events, Flop Auctions. However, since the current market conditions have produced an uncertainty to such, we believe and agree with the community that deactivating the lerp is the right temporary move. We have always been advocates of a larger Surplus Buffer, so this is good time to accumulate such and add some proponents to the theory that a heftier SB is a good thing. We are fully confident the Maker Community will formulate and agree on a solution to restart burning MKR in due time.

content.content: Extend the Delegate Compensation Trial - February 7, 2022 Voted YES – theirs a major need for Recruiting more Delegates in order to improve the quality and quantity of Delegates that want to be 100% focus–day-in and day-out–on MakerDAO–and MakerDAO only. And how do we do that? We continue to compensate Delegate Platforms that are dedicated to go beyond their call-of-duty, and who want to unite this DAO via an aligned vision. We are at a pivotal time where the community needs direction, needs a united vision, alignment, and we believe Delegates can play a role in supporting both the visions and goals of the Core Units, and MKR token owners.  Offloading TUSD-A - February 7, 2022 Rank Choice Voting First Choice: Offload to a new TUSD-PSM with 0 Debt Ceiling. Prefer to explore this option further, as the community was not provided with a risky analysis of Activating Liquidations, and the risks associated with such. We ask that the community explore the risk of Liquidating (Front Running Bots/MEV/slippage)  versus offloading in an orderly fashion via a new TUSD-PSM with 0 DC. As an example, can a major MM desk offload TUSD exclusively and orderly, how much will a “MM desk” charge, versus the possibility of incurring loses via liquidations. Second Choice: Activate Liquidations If an analysis shows that activating liquidations works best, we will be supportive of this method.  Introduce Rate Limiting into the Flapper - February 7, 2022 Voted YES although this Poll can be misinterpreted–its pretty much a Greenlight Poll, and this solution is incomplete because it doesn’t do much for the proponents who want MKR burns. There are no winners here(except the objective to avoid 0 bids). We also believe the Burner should stay turned-off until we have a long-term solution in place. The 3F Delegate Motto is, “playing long-term games, with long-term people.” Please note that we opposed this Signal Request. BUT, we have noticed how the community sentiment is split on this subject and others pertaining to the growth of the Surplus Buffer. Therefore, we want to provide support for those that want to explore the Rate Limiter, and for that reason we have voted Yes. However we will not support going back to the same Surplus Buffer configuration. Let’s find a common ground for the long-term benefit of MakerDAO.

content.content: Executive Proposals  GUSD PSM Maximum Debt Ceiling Increase, MakerMan Retroactive Delegate Compensation - February 25, 2022 Currently opposing this Executive based on the proposal to increase the GUSD PSM Debt Ceiling. We have provided our reasoning and have requested community comments here: [EXECUTIVE VOTE NOTICE] 3F Delegate Cannot Support an INCREASE of the GUSD PSM Debt Ceiling Notifying @GovAlpha-Core-Unit that a dissenting vote of an Executive is a Vote. Delegates cannot be expected to Vote YES to every Executive without exercising a reasonable justifiable and appropriate persistent effort to oppose.  EDIT 27/02/2022:In The Spirit of Keeping The Maker Governance Safe, We Have Chosen To Protect The HAT ** This Executive has no substance, it does not improve the protocol and yes, some will argue that it bares no risk. This is good opportunity to explore Delegate best practices, as well as making sure GovAlpha is constructing Executives that are beneficial to the protocol. @psychonaut has ask what is the pretext of 3F Delegate not supporting this Executive? First we don’t want people to think that Delegates are automatically hitting the YES Button on every Executive. We believe that Delegates need to be diligent and objective when representing MKR token owners. We, Delegates are being compensated to perform these task on behalf of MKR token owners. Automatically hitting the YES button without thinking things through is a worrisome practice, IMO. Second, this Signal Request was introduced by a 3rd party that is in the business of creating proposals and establishing a track record of governance. There is absolutely nothing wrong with that. Governance mining, or as I like to call it “Governance-as-a-Service”, is a valuable service in Decentralized Governance. But as you know, MKR token owners and Delegates have a duty to protect MakerDAO and thoroughly choose what’s best for the DAO regardless of who or what is proposed. That should always be priority number one. I believe we can agree on that. Third, MKR token owners and Delegates should support our Core Units when partners are not delivering on their promises.If a partner is not supporting our Core Unit vision — then we Delegates and MKR token owners should support our core units when partners actions are not beneficial to MakerDAO. We are disappointed that some Delegates Left the HAT Vulnerable over an Executive with no Purpose.  image1920×748 68 KB

content.content: Active Polls 2 POLLS - ENDING MAR 10 2022 16:00 UTC  Off-boarding Parameters for TUSD-A - March 7, 2022 Voted YES to some interesting Parameters–including setting the "tau to 21,600,000 second (est. 10bps drop per 6 hours = 250 days till 0)", which can be interpreted as mathematical genius by the Risk Core Unit, or the showcasing of their fine-toothed comb approach. Their detailed research on setting the proper parameters for offloading TUSD includes a worst-case scenario of approximately 699K DAI Bad Debt that the Surplus Buffer will need to be responsible for.  Reinstate Surplus Buffer Lerp - March 7, 2022 As we start this journey into what some are labeling as a “Long-term Bear Market”, we are proponents of using the DAO’s resources to focus on scaling via D3Ms, ZK-Rollups, sidechains, Maker Wormhole, and the emergence of CanonicalDAI as the premier stablecoin of Decentralized Finance. It is in these moments of time that we believe the mindset of MakerDAO should be on building, innovating, and staying focus on a wider profitable path. At a protocol burn-rate of $42M per year, our main focus should be on scaling the Surplus Buffer. Since 2018 we have over-occupied ourselves watching the Price movements of MKR. We can attest that nor-burning or burning have ever had an impact on the price of MKR. Markets are irrational and burning MKR has never led to positive price action. In fact, at times we were dumbfounded that MKR burning always went unnoticed. But as time elapsed we realized that MKR price action does not get impacted if the MakerDAO Float is 900,000 tokens or, 1,080,000 tokens. It Never matter. Unfortunately the Market does Not care lerp, or no lerp–MKR price action will remain the same. For more details of what we have personally witness, check out this op-ed Against The Burn. In 2020 we witness the Flop Auctions that had the community’s stomach churning. It was a moment in time that we do not to want to relive. At this stage in history, Maker needs to continue to stay resilient, independent, vigorous, and innovative. It is because of the passion to see it succeed that we ask the community to delay the topic of burning of MKR. Believe us, we fell in Love with MKR because of the Burn. But at this moment, we are more passionate about scaling the Surplus Buffer. We move to Vote NO in support for The Need To Scale MakerDAO, Beyond The Lerp.

This Declaration covers the essential needs in order for a solution to be consider, including but not limited to requirements pertaining to both legal and investment structures, investment grade, and commonality in liquidity. When you assess the team members both FT and PT, and add up this budget request, you clearly realized that GovAlpha has the core values of a team that is servicing the DAO because they have an internal passion for MakerDAO. They have social dignity and integrity. Because of these traits we believe the entire community should continue to support GovAlpha.  Ratification Poll for Modify Core Unit Budget - Real-World Finance (RWF-001) (MIP40c3-SP61) - March 14, 2022 Voted YES – we believe it’s important to support this budget as MakerDAO’s long-awaited attempt at on-boarding Real World Assets finally makes a push in 2022. It is also our believe that if MKR token owners and Delegates do not support this proposal, it will hamper the ability of both the RWF CU and the incoming RWA Legal & Transaction Services (LTS) facilitator to complete the Professional Services required for deals such as the SocGen on-boarding application, and the current pipeline:  image1836×532 73.9 KB  **  Screeshot was captured during RWF’s office hours on 16/03/2022 The Community does not understand the role of RWF-001 Auditor Wallet: 0x96d7b01Cc25B141520C717fa369844d34FF116ec As we read comment after comment from both the community and Delegates, it became quite apparent to us that the community does not comprehend the role an Auditor Wallet can play in funding a budget, such as the budget request made by RWF. There is a Need for the RWF Core Unit Team To Speak Up and Communicate w/the Community The community cannot expect miracles to occur without providing the necessary Runway for Core Units to scale. There has been a miscommunication between RWF and the community, which we believe has led to a misunderstanding on how this Core Unit plans to push RWAs forward. Therefore, we highly recommend that the RWF team members speak up, participate in the community’s conversations and guide the subject of RWAs more efficiently. You’ll Never Get a Breakthrough if You Play it Safe There’s an open question if 2022 will be the year that RWA collateral types will scale. As proponents of Risk taking, we do believe that it is important for the RWF team to allow the likes of Monetalis, 6s Capital, Centrifuge, and other Arranger types to scale via the superpowers of MakerDAO, know as Vaults. content.content: Active Polls 4 POLLS - ENDING MAR 31 2022 16:00 UTC  Short Ratification Poll for SPF ETHAmsterdam Event (MIP55c3-SP3) - March 28, 2022 Voted YES – Branding, branding, branding. Why is branding so important? One of the most obvious reasons that DeFi protocols need branding is to help them get recognized more often. But in a competitive ecosystem such as decentralized finance, branding makes a memorable impression on consumers but more importantly, it allows your users to know what to expect from your organization. And when you attend the Harvard Blockchain Conference, and some of the attendees tell you that they had no idea MakerDAO is the platform that governs and provides life for DAI to exist, you quickly realized that the branding of both Maker and DAI has been non-existent. And when folks tell you that DAO Maker and MakerDAO are the same protocol that mints DAI, you get this feeling of emptiness but more importantly you wonder what went wrong. The truth is we All know that branding is important. And now the question is, how do we allocate budgets that allow marketing teams to help us brand DAI + MakerDAO as one. While 3F Delegate and the rest of the community does not have sufficient data to analyze if the recent launch of DAIvinity will produce branding, or result in protocol growth–we believe it is necessary to support this event that has the potential to leave a memorable impression on those who believe in both decentralized finance and Web 3. In the near future we are proponents of allocating a budget that is firmed and allows marketing/events teams to work with such without the need to use an SPF, or the budgets of other Core Units. We are also hopeful that co-sponsorships can and will be attained in the near future that will lead to some memorable branding.  Initial Parameters for StarkNet Simple DAI Bridge - March 28, 2022 Voted YES as we are proponents of StarkNet L2 and are hereby supporting the maximum amount 5M DAI in the L1 bridge contract. We had the pleasure of meeting some members of the StarkWare Community, along with one of the co-founders, a board member, and others alike at the HBC StarkWare Meetup in Boston. A very impressive community who is full-of-energy, ideas, and more importantly they are All excited to finally see the StarkNet vision come into fruition.  Short Ratification Poll for MIP62 Amendments (MIP4c3-SP2) - March 28, 2022 Voted YES in supporting the amending of MIP62c2 to MIP62c3 which reflects the off-boarding of the Content CU rather than making entire changes to MIP62. Makes sense.  Investigate Implementation of a Notional Finance D3M - March 28, 2022 Voted NO as much as we would like to see hundreds of D3M implementations, we believe MakerDAO Core Units should stay focused on implementing the current backlog. Time consuming and costly integrations will take a lot of effort and the DAO teams are already overextended. Also, a good analysis of why we currently oppose investigating this implementation and why we believe it felt rushed and not properly analyzed by the proposer is based on this forum post by CES contributor @M_C If we propose a technological integration before discussing the business opportunity we are already discussing the solution instead of the problem. As aspected, CES will play a huge role in helping MKR token owners and Delegates make a free and democratic decision on the onboarding of all collateral types. While we encourage more enthusiastic proposals from the proposer ( a delegate themselves ), we ask that they provide the Maker Community with implementations that make business sense, third-party implementations that are well negotiated and reward MKR token owners. 3F Delegate is a proponent in rewarding MKR token owners with incentives. As the saying goes, the principal’s incentives are different than the agent’s incentives.

With the initial assessment leaning to an anemic DC, and most of those concerns being set aside, we are strong supporters of helping this Collateral Type scale. 12 POLLS - ENDING APR 25 2022 16:00 UTC  Ratification Poll for Dissolution of Content Production, MKT-001, Multi-Sig Request (MIP47c3-SP1) - April 11, 2022 Voted YES – The Content Production Core Unit has been off-boarded and  their wallet needs to be removed from the recognized multi-sig list. It will be a challenge to recover the small amount of funds that can still be claimed–will need some technical work–but all in all, this is a good learning lesson for the DAO.  Ratification Poll for Modify Protocol Engineering Core Unit Budget, PE-001 (MIP40c3-SP68) - April 11, 2022 Voted “YESSSSSSS” to one of the most important components of MakerDAO, PECU. The recent success of MakerDAO can be attributed to the hard work and dedication produced by its Team Members. PECU is arguably the heart-beat of MakerDAO. No doubt about it. We believe that rejecting a budget request from a team that has consistently produced results and has volunteered to take the same salaries as the previous year, will be detrimental to their confidence in believing that Maker Governance will support those that sacrifice their lives in order to protect the DAO. And it will quickly erase any excitement for the hiring of future engineers who seek to one-day build on the most decentralized protocol on Earth. This Team has grown–and we believe some in the community do not recognize, or know about the hidden talent this Core Unit possesses, or the endless sleepless nights they’ve had. We urge MKR token owners and Delegates to please, don’t send PE and other important CU a negative signal to prove a point. More importantly, PE has signal their intent to create a 3-way work-stream composed of Core Protocol, Cross Domain Scaling, and Safety. This initiative needs to be supported as PE believes it will create an efficient work environment. It can also decentralize the Core Unit–which will be a first for this DAO. And we fully agree, and urge every single MKR token owner and Delegate to vote YESSSSSSS.  Ratification Poll for Adding CES-001 as a Collateral Onboarding Domain Team - April 11, 2022 Voted “Yesssssss” in support of onboarding the entire CES team via the MIP7 onboarding process. If this Poll & subsequent Executive passes, it will Add CES to MIP7c2 to the Current Domain Roles List, which is currently composed of PECU, Oracles CU, Risk, and “Legal.” We support this onboarding as CES has shown a tremendous effort, dedication, and work ethic in trying to solve the collateral onboarding, collateral onboarding, and maintenance process.  Ratification Poll for Modify the Collateral Application Form (MIP6c3-SP2) - April 11, 2022 Voted “Yes” to modify/Amend the collateral application template. This amendment will add important questions to the MIP6 application that allows CUs, MKR Token Owners, and Delegates to more easily assess if a collateral type is qualified to be onboarded. With the need to help both MKR token owners and Delegates greenlight MIP6 applicants, this modification finally aids those that have ask for the much needed help.  Ratification Poll for Methodology and Review Process for Structured Finance Transactions (MIP67) - April 11, 2022 Voted “YES,” in support of a methodology that will implement checks and balances–a benchmark that will help attract quality borrowers and clarifies the necessary frameworks needed in order to onboard RWA collateral types. This framework will also help align and communicate to the world, the necessary requirements needed in order to become an RWA collateral type. We believe implementing a framework that hails MakerDAO as a senior secured lender with favorable rights for loan transactions. This will help the DAO determine what course of action it should take when a Default occurs. It will also help the RWF CU, incubating LOVE-01 CU, and proposed Legal CU create assessments that can determine if the MIP6 applicant has the ability to pay Stability Fees and principal under the terms of the legal/deal documents. Without an RWA methodology, we believe MakerDAO will not be taken serious as a Real World Lender. And because we believe that some digital asset will become global powerhouses, DAI must be showcased as a digital asset that has the ability to compete on the World’s stage. MIP67 will help real world financing companies understand the requirements needed in order to access DAI RWA Vaults, a powerful tool. It will also help showcase the current RWA Core Units team members years of experience in selecting the right projects, and structuring RWA deals in a correct manner. However, let’s not forget that MKR token owners will always have the final say. 3F Delegate is a proponent of implementing a secondary RWA Core Unit that will provide incoming RWA startups the ability to access the powerful tools of MakerDAO. This secondary Core Unit will inspired the next Generation MIP6 applicants to showcase themselves. Perhaps a former employee of a successful borrower who acquired the expertise and is now ready to explore uncharted waters. Such CU should follow a different Methodology that allows entrepreneurs the access and the freedom to perform lending best practices via Maker Vaults. After all, MakerDAO was built by taking-on Risk. And finally, we cannot begin to tell you how many times we have been ask by personal connections hailing from TradFi organizations, as to why MakerDAO is giving out risk-free loans? Some sounded baffled–as they proceeded to deviate from further discussing if MakerDAO is a serious lender. And it’s these misconception that can easily attract fraudulent borrowers. The MakerDAO community cannot afford to take on risks that it cannot afford. The off-chain world is opaque, and many borrowers are inexperienced. Defaults will happen. With a Surplus Buffer that allows this DAO to take minimal off-chain risk, there’s no viable reason why MIP67 should not be supported.

content.content: Active Polls 5 POLLS - ENDING APR 25 2022 16:00 UTC  Ratification Poll for Adding Events Core Unit (EVENTS-001) - April 11, 2022 Voted Yes — as we are currently witnessing a worldwide exodus from the pandemic locked-down phase—we are exiting a time when humanity was prohibited from physically feeling the essence and the importance of togetherness, this proposed Core Unit is helping bringing back the BRANDING and the importance of unity + DAIvinity, but also the recognition of the brand, “MakerDAO.” That feeling of being together again. That feeling that showcases our innovative freedom. That feeling of being reborn. Free to roam the streets. It is because of this feeling that MakerDAO is publicly started to communicate again, thanks to this proposed Core Unit team.  Ratification Poll for Pairwyse Licensure (MIP66) - April 11, 2022. Voted NO previously  3F Delegate had been a proponent of Fix Rate protocols. Since then, such platforms have proven that Product-Market is not here today. On a weekend when we are seeing platforms like Bastion (Compound Fork) garner $800M++ of TVL in less than 30-days, we ask ourselves what can Fix Yield platforms offer to the Growth of MakerDAO? And quite frankly, there is no Market appetite for such product. Let’s be honest, Fix Yield is not viable today. Maybe tomorrow.  But not today.  Ratification Poll for Governance Communications Core Unit, COM-001, Mandate Refresh (MIP39c2-SP30) - April 11, 2022 Voted NO because of the reasons stated below with regards to prop 62 & 63   and our desire to have also seen the Vision/Mandate refresh include the following initiatives:  Developing a cohesive communications strategy Assembling and overseeing a diversely skilled communications team Projecting a positive company image to the public Develop a brand voice and maintain brand integrity across all platforms Develop contacts with media members, influencers and community leaders   Ratification Poll for Modify Core Unit Budget, COM-001 (MIP40c3-SP62) - April 11, 2022 Voted NO–please see my DM to David as to why 3F Delegate is voting NO to this prop     Ratification Poll for Modify Core Unit Budget, COM-001 (MIP40c3-SP63) - April 11, 2022 EXCERPTS FROM A CONVERSATION I HAD WITH DAVID UTROBIN VIA DISCORD Thank you for the feedback David. As you know, the most important responsibilities of COM-001 are to set the tone for messaging and portraying values of the DAO. As you know that COM-001 is responsible for establishing relationships with media outlets, developing strategic communication plans and handling public relations issues that arise internally and externally. Other duties include the task of establishing a multi-channel communications strategy, and establishing and maintains contacts with media members, influencers, and community leaders. And some duties can also involve marketing and content creation. And as you also know, public  perception is key. And after further review, I believe COM-001 has fallen short. And I partially blame it on perhaps the current  budget—maybe it was insufficient. I also blame it on the fact that you’re a small team and the off-boarding of the content Core Unit impacted your ability to produce the creation of digital, video, and audio communication material. I also believe your budget request ( prop 62 & 63 ) are excessive when you compare the budget request from teams like GovAlpha. And I don’t think it’s your fault—I believe it’s a combination of not having the proper resources  to structure a specific budget that will contain too much expectations. I also believe that perhaps you lack the inexperience of running a business, and the expectations that delegates had from COM-001 have fallen short. On occasions I have personally felt disappointed that no communication was made public with regards to MakerDAO accomplishments, and equally the communication of our disappointments. We have lacked communication related to our products, and perhaps a written, or verbal explanation of the complexities of running a DAO (the forum has been a battlefield). This DAO needed Your Core Unit then more than ever. And  I should have spoken up and communicated my disappointment. But I did not and this is why it pains me to tell you that 3F Delegate cannot support prop 62, 63 and the  COM-001 mandate refresh. I wanted to support you, personally—because you are talented and I know you are a piece of the MakerDAO heartbeat. But I have to be honest and tell you that I would be lying to myself if I supported COM-001 based on your personal talents as oppose to what works best for the DAO. And I don’t believe myself and other delegates believe that COM-001 produces sufficient value for the requested budget allocation. I believe you should revisit your budget and propose a better path forward that can and will deliver the expected results.

content.content: Active Polls 2 POLLS - ENDING MAY 16 2022 16:00 UTC  Community Greenlight Poll - ATDC (ATD Combustors) - May 2, 2022 Voted YES to Green-lighting this Poll and here’s why:  While indeed–the “the proposed return is below the risk-free rate (US treasuries) of similar duration” it is “proposed” and open to negotiation. Analysis needs to go beyond the substance of a proposed rate–we have expectations that RWA Core Units have the ability to negotiate for the benefit of MakerDAO. We don’t expect MKR token owners to accept initial proposed rates by RWA applicants. We believe that focusing too much on the substance of the deal and not enough on the process, never leads to a good outcome. 3F Delegate advice: Negotiate process before substance.  We agree that MakerDAO needs an RWA wholesaler mentally of funding via innovative tools such as the D3M, “underwrite the underwriter”, it is not a bullet-proof strategy because you are still relying on the eagerness of others to perform the due-diligence. And forget crypto’s least favorite acronym, KYC, how about KYS (Know Your Supplier)? And while the D3M will kickstart a new method of RWA funding, this nascent science of funding RWA collateral types will take time while RWA applicants decipher the ever-changing landscape of onboarding via an already slow-moving Governance process, and a trajectory that has thrown more curveballs at MIP6 applicants than Tom Seaver threw in the 1969 World Series.  ATCD is in a Clean Money State of mind. Every country is in need of strengthening the resilience of their supply-chains. Unfortunately, the CapEx of strengthening their LNG infrastructure and building those proposed pipelines within Europe will be EXPENSIVE. But more importantly these supply-chain resilient tasks will also need to offset emissions as the discussion on the energy transition to a carbon-neutral world gathers pace and strength. And we believe ATCD can position itself as key player in reducing the carbon footprint while reducing energy costs. Please let us participate in this world-changing task, as oppose to taking the easy road and overlooking the clean intentions of this project. We ask that this ATCD deal be explored more, beyond a MIP Forum post with numbers and words. Because our reliance on the environment is more substantial than the current Fed Funds rate.    Community Greenlight Poll - IPCL (India Power Green Bonds) - May 2, 2022 Voted YES to the prospect of further investigating a company (India Power) that hails from a country (India) that has an impressive energy transformation currently underway. India is aiming to reach net-zero emissions by 2070. That my dear community is impressive. When you couple that with the fact that people in India consume less Energy than citizens of the United States and renewable electricity is growing at a faster rate in India than any other major economy–MakerDAO would be insane not to at least investigate this opportunity to fund India Power’s renewable projects with DAI. We don’t believe that we’ve yet to have a sit-down with India Power. Come on folks, let’s talk, let’s negotiate, let’s make an effort to help change the world. Also, we need to explore if this deal can get RBI (Reserve Bank of India) approval. How can MakerDAO + DAI reach the minds & eyes of billions of India’s citizens, if we don’t even try?  To underwrite, or not to underwrite. That is the Question. The recent recommendations pertaining to these two (2) MIP6 applications leaves us wondering if the current RWF Core Unit is indicating that MakerDAO should not underwrite deals. This is an unclear message that needs to be communicated more clearly for the benefit of MKR token owners. We believe that the community’s expectations are that the RWF CU will conduct an independent investigation of the issuer and the issue. These are the same expectations shareholders have of underwriters like GS, JPM, Credit Suisse, etc., hence–we have the same expectations. If this Core Unit does not believe that “underwriting” will be beneficial to MakerDAO, this needs to openly communicated to the Community. We are open-minded. Furthermore, MKR token owners have expectations that RWF CU will focus on providing up-to-date information, details of trends, and present status of current collateral types, along with “boots-on-the-ground” (let’s get out there). Communicate any due-diligence that is hampered by the borrower/applicant, corrections, clarifications, and modifications. These are some of the expectations we have going into the latter half of 2022.

content.content: Active Polls 5 POLLS - ENDING MAY 23 2022 16:00 UTC  Ratification Poll for Monetalis Clydesdale, Liquid Bond Strategy & Execution (MIP65) - May 9, 2022 Voted YES as the need to diversify the PSM USDC exposure is long-overdue and this MIP allows MakerDAO to diversify from counterparty risk and attain Yield while using an appropriate legal structure and technical solution. This MIP also allows MakerDAO to gain exposure to professional bond managers and it entails allocation restrictions that might not comply with the DAO’s Clean Money Initiative and MKR token owners objectives. We also believe the commitment to deliver any Surplus back to the DAO on a quarterly basis is beneficial as only a few RWA Collateral Types to date have generated an ROI. We are also excited to greet and meet some qualified and a mix of bond managers in the near future, as we are believers that this MIP65 proposal by Monetalis will deliver results.  Ratification Poll for Monetalis Lusitano, UK Green Economy SME Wholesale Lending (MIP68) - May 9, 2022 Voted YES to a Lending Strategy named after the elegant Lusitano horse breed that possesses  strong nerves and the agile adoption to attain the rider’s requirements. MIP68 consist of portfolios that will align with the Clean Money vision, and will create opportunities including market-making in the Climate-financing market, while keeping Maker Senior. With big Finance starting to go green and Pension Funds starting to divest from fossil-fuel firms, the Big Automobile manufacturers committing to building more EVs in order to become carbon neutral, we believe Lusitano can be the first SME lending platform that can position MakerDAO as an early beneficiary of the climate market momentum. With the passing of this MIP–MakerDAO can position itself as the lead for the development of new generation climate-markets. We also believe that Monetalis has done the necessary research and due-diligence to structure a Lending Vehicle that contains the necessary checks & balances via MIP21. This includes but its not limited to the verification of a Professional Trustee by the incubating Legal CU, a cash and security agent, auditor, custodian, and legal advisor. All these key pieces need to work together in order to provide MKR token owners reports and evaluations on the success of Lusitano. This approach also allows the platform to be flexible, in order to diversify MakerDAO’s exposure to one single point of failure. All-in-all we are betting on the Jockey and not the Horse. We move to Vote YES.  Ratification Poll for L2-to-L1 Fast Withdrawals (MIP69) - May 9, 2022 Voted YES to the long-waited release of the Maker Teleport and MIP69 calls for requestMint via a fast withdraw of DAI from L2  to L1 that burns DAI on L2 and sends an L2 → L1 message to withdraw DAI from the L2 bridge without an operatorFee. We are super excited to witness the Maker Teleport go live.  Ratification Poll for MIP40 Budget Process Amendment (MIP4c2-SP19) - May 9, 2022 Voted YES to this amendment that will hopefully improve budget future proposals and requests. We do believe that Core Units might find the structure a bit overwhelming, but we believe MKR token owners can decide if a Core Unit budget proposal/request is acceptable even if the MIP40 proposal is delivered “somewhat” incomplete via this process. While we welcome the amendment to improve the process, we don’t believe it will make it that much easier for Delegates and MKR token owners to decide if the requested budget amounts are justifiable. We will continue to lean on the help of our Core Units and the MIP Author (SF CU), but perhaps this process will make it that much easier. However, this amendment does allow MKR token owners to keep-up with Core Unit head-counts (at times extremely opaque), business continuity, CU objectives, and how a Core Unit can be wound-down in the event of a Governance vote to defund it (extremely important). Therefore we move to support this amendment by Voting YES.  Ratification Poll for Strategic Happiness (SH-001) Core Unit Budget Modification (MIP40c3-SP67) - May 9, 2022 Fully Support this Core Unit that is in the business of spreading MakerDAO love   & happiness via swag airdrops(a.k.a branding), a man who is willing to go the distance to make sure Maker’s presence is felt at some of the Top-Events in the ecosystem. We have witness this Facilitator go the extra mile, carry boxes of swag across borders, on commercial flights, on a family-minivan, negotiate his way into a foreign jurisdiction (Customs) in order to deliver MakerDAO Happiness, all while spending his own personal money to make it happen. It is our pleasure to fully support a Core Unit that eats, breaths, and dreams about MKR. We Vote YES to MIP40c3-SP67!

We believe the Origination Fee (1% of DAI minted) offers MakerDAO initial and much needed upside, while the discounted SF rate of 50 bips for ETH-A / WBTC-A vaults offers a new paradigm of deal-structuring for IV vaults in the near future. We are in a period where there’s a demand and supply for credit that is having an effect of moving us into a stagflation environment (slow growth, and high asset pricing, a.k.a. as inflation). Launch Maker Teleport with 1 Basis Point Fee - May 23, 2022 Voted NO, as we are active users of Stargate, Hop, Optimism/Arbitrum/Polygon bridge, the list goes on and on–they ALL charge a fee. We believe that D3M applicants should also put in the work when applying for such.

Active Polls 3 POLLS - ENDING JUN 16 2022 16:00 UTC  Deploy a Trial Permissionless Open Market Operation - June 13, 2022 Voted NO – Right now the ecosystem has a lot to deal with including the current depleting crypto market conditions and the opaque macro environment that has led to decentralized finance conditions deteriorated further and faster than expected. When this Proposal was first made, market conditions were uncertain and MakerDAO needed a spark, a way to reward MKR owners. Since then, MKR token value has contracted ~40% and the value of ETH has dropped by ~35% in the span of 20 trading sessions. As history has thought us, PLCs that bought back equity during growth cycles and entered a cycle of uncertainty, those companies that spent billions of dollars on share buybacks over previous years–they’ve struggled with little cash on had. And we understand that this Proposal’s burn rate at the proposed configuration would result in roughly 33K DAI being burned daily, but that amount of money can be used to minimize Risk and work on the upcoming protocol Growth Initiatives, with an emphasis on educating the masses of what exactly is MakerDAO. The DssKiln is a terrific purchasing and disposition tool and we know one-day it will be put to good use, and eventually automate the permissionless purchasing of MKR and other treasury assets. At the moment, we believe the Community should NOT be focused on extracting value, but instead focus on minimizing risk and maximizing quality Growth.  Management of Velodrome Airdrop and veNFT - June 13, 2022 Voted YES to this new AMM Optimism platform that has airdropped its $VELO governance token to DAO supporters, among others. This layer-2 scaling solution for Ethereum will include a trading and liquidity marketplace designed to provide deep liquidity and low fee/slippage trades. The airdropped tokens can be locked for veVELO, which provides voting rights and conforms to the ERC-721 standard (i.e., veNFT). This proposal will target the DAI/USDC and DAI/OP pairs and send any incurred rewards to the MakerDAO Optimism Governance Address.  Add rETH as a new Vault Type - June 13, 2022 Voted NO – this is too small of a Collateral Type with too much required involvement by Risk CU (who sounds like the proposed parameter of DC-IAM gap: 3m is meh, just enough risk mitigation to keep MakerDAO safe), Protocol Engineering, Oracles (who did not sound too excited about this collateral type, and finally Collateral Engineering Services who has a pile of irons in the fire. And all this work for 225 basis points. While All of these resources combined can be used to focus on tackling the collateral types that will keep this train moving forward, and mitigate risk to keep Maker sailing.  Community Greenlight Poll - KREDIKA (Kredika LTD) - June 6, 2022 Voted NO because currently the pipeline for RWF is too inundated with proposals that we believe require more bandwidth. We also believe these type of proposal eat a ton-of-resources from a Team that’s struggling to get RWAs of the ground. The MakerDAO community has already endured painless months of trying to onboard the SG Forge collateral. Let’s work on the current pipeline and let’s streamline the RWA onboarding collateral process so that the DAO can immediately incur revenues and set a positive precedent for All future applicants. We ask Kredika to re-apply at a later date once we have expanded the RWA bandwidth and the onboarding process has improved 10X. Otherwise, a “greenlight” from MKR token owners and Delegates will only inundate you with obstacles. Trust us, it’s currently not a fun experience.  Community Greenlight Poll - XSGD (StraitsX) - June 6, 2022 Voted NO to XSGD, a Singapore-dollar backed stablecoin that is fully Fiat collateralized. We believe MakerDAO has enough centralized Fiat exposure via the PSM and that exposure more than likely will grow, as Circle’s USDC is out there designing their strategy to 100x in the next 2 to 5 years. 2 POLLS - ENDING JUN 27 2022 16:00 UTC  Ratification Poll for Onboard Growth Task Force (MIP75c3-SP1) - June 13, 2022 Voted for ONLY 1 Choice:  REJECT TASK FORCE – My first reaction to the Name “Task Force” hit home because I reside from a City that uses multiple Task Forces to implement centralized control over particular Governmental initiatives. Task Force is identified by many here as not being community friendly; therefore supporting a second Ranked-Choice (IRV) for a proposal that my brain interprets as a negative connotation left me unmotivated to select a second choice. However, since this MIP proposal was presented to the community, I have given it the benefit of the doubt and tried to understand it. Using my business logic, I don’t believe that this “Task Force” has drawn-out a decentralized network-theory that convinces how their vision of Growth will start decentralizing  locally (within the Maker Community), and then spreading a vision with the involvement of the entire ecosystem. And in order to convince MKR token owners that you have the team, the idea, and the credibility to make this initiative work, FAST–you will put yourself in a position where you’re going to draw-it-up as you move–without a decentralized consensus–and more than likely you’re just trapping yourselves in a network that will never hyper-accelerate. This opinion is one of many reasons that made this proposal feel rushed and quite frankly caught many community members by surprise. Therefore, we move to Reject.  Ratification Poll for Facilitator Onboarding to IS-001 - @psychonaut (MIP41c4-SP34) - June 13, 2022 Voted NO – Originally when @SES-Core-Unit recommended Joshua Pritikin for Deputy Facilitator we were surprised. I have been with Josh in this very community since the Rocket Chat days and he has his own believes that can be creative and perhaps unique. All in all as a participant of this community he has been treat to have. And since we believe SES must have made an assessment of the prospect, we agreed and supported the Vote to add Josh as Deputy Facilitator of IS-001. When Josh decided to create the Delegate Compensation I was taken-back that @GovAlpha-Core-Unit and the Maker Community allowed the MIP to flow through without questioning much of it. I say this because that was a pivotal moment in decentralizing and scaling MKR delegated voting. And since, 3F Delegate decided to Abstain from Delegate Comp commentary and polling, I was really surprised the MIP was put to a vote. But okay… Again, we believe Josh is a dedicated Maker Community Member. That can never be questioned. However, a good facilitator is focused on the topics at hand that pertain to his/her Core Unit, and the optimal path to reach and communicate his/her Core Unit objectives. We believe Josh has not deliver these requirements. When you’re a facilitator you should more than likely disclosed that your post is your personal Opinion and not the voice of your Core Unit.  If you spend all-of-your time on this Forum and the community realm, you might have come across 1 or 2 opinions by Josh that might leave you a bit baffled. And since Josh is currently a Deputy Facilitator for one of our very expensive and important Core Unit Teams, his judgment has lacked. All community members in order to be consider for a Core Unit Facilitator role should have better judgement and if you disagree with this Vote you need to ask yourself, what exactly is the role of a Facilitator?  You should look it up. Or, you can take my word for it  A facilitator needs to be a Motivator, a peacemaker, a guide, bridge builder, and among other things a praiser. And Josh lacks these traits as a Deputy Facilitator of the Immunefi Core Unit. And there’s nothing wrong w/being a Core Unit member who’s outspoken and once in a while makes judgements that  don’t support the mission of makerDAO, but as a Facilitator of a MakerDAO Core Unit… those are some of the important skills that every facilitator needs to possess. And believe me! I know Josh has a unique skill-set that can help this DAO move forward. But the clairvoyant uniqueness of a Facilitator is missing for Josh. We move to vote No.

Ratification Poll for Adding Lending Oversight Core Unit (LOVE-001) - June 13, 2022 Voted YES to the onboarding of the Lending Oversight CU based on the skillset that this team can provide to MakerDAO. Their understanding of structure finance, the PE markets, valuations and financial modeling will be key in performing these needed services once Real-World Assets become more institutionalized. This Core Unit needs to be valued for what they can provide, and not because the immediate reaction is that they’ll “gate-keep” any RWA collaterals from being onboarded. Let the MKR token owners decide what they believe is best for MakerDAO, and only accept their assessment  as just that. An opinion. Because at the end of the day, the Markets, our users, our partners, and our willingness to fail is what will decide our success.  Ratification Poll for Task Forces (MIP75) - June 13, 2022. Voted NO, as stated in our review of the Ratification Poll for the onboarding of a Growth Task Force, we will not be supporting components of MakerDAO that are titled with what we beloieve is a negative connotation. More importantly it is currently not the right time to deploy “teams” that will be in need of funding while the market remains wary from a deleveraging contagion.  Ratification Poll for Adding a Special Purpose Fund - Makershire Hathaway (MIP55c3-SP4) - June 13, 2022 Voted NO – we believe the timing is incorrect as the entire DeFi ecosystem contains too much counterparty risk. Currently DAI yield generation strategies are anemic. We request for SF to take time to create a reassessment once the dust clears and pounce on ideas that are unique and innovative. The stars will never be aligned, but there’s always tomorrow to rebrand and reintroduce this idea.  Ratification Poll for MIP16 Amendments (MIP4c2-SP20) - June 13, 2022 Voted YES to these much need amendment that we believe works really well as it will have 2-weekly gov cycles running simultaneously.  Ratification Poll for Permissionless Open Market Operations (MIP74) - June 13, 2022 Voted YES to this MIP that incorporates a very unique tool called the DssKiln that can be used to manage the surplus buffer, treasury, or any other assets on Maker’s balance sheet. Although I might not agree that deploying it right now to burn MKR is the way to go, I do believe the DssKiln module is an innovative tool that will be very useful in the near future. Therefore we move to support it.  Budget Ratification Poll for Modify Strategic Finance Core Unit Budget, SF-001 (MIP40c3-SP69) - June 13, 2022 1st CHOICE: Approve existing budget only (business as usual) As Raekwon once said, “Times are rough and tough like leather.” And I believe Startegic Finance would agree that this is the right path. There will be a day when this team will grow 10x, but for now let’s use the resources available until we start firing on all cylinders. Otherwise, this CU has done a terrific job and has been very vocal in supporting the growth of the protocol. We are lucky to have this team and it’s only a matter of time before MKR token owners and Delegates provide them with the necessary tools to expand their vision.  Ratification Poll for Onboard/Amend Keep3r Network (MIP63c4-SP4) - June 13, 2022 Voted YES in support of a much needed addition, as the push to decentralize the keepers and lower the dependency from TechOps to provide such services.  Budget Ratification Poll for Modify Growth Core Unit Budget, GRO-001 (MIP40c3-SP70) - June 13, 2022 Voted for 1st Choice:  Approve increased budget (BearMarket) Voted for 2nd Choice: Approve existing budget only (BrandlessGrowth) I’ve been thinking a lot about the trajectory the Growth Team is taking now that it is adding/moving to branding and marketing. Since this idea was presented by Growth to the community, I’ve personally have had a difficult time understanding how a “Business Development” team takes over Marketing. On one hand I get that some organizations lump-together the sales team with a marketing team. But my personal desire to see more sales coming through the door, are a lot more important than marketing. The preference for 3F Delegate is more Sales. Yes, marketing is also needed. Desperately. But there’s nothing in the world like closing deals. At the same token, I also understand that if the EndGame is the pivot that MKR token owners and Delegates decide upon, this Team won’t have a clear vision. Therefore, we move to Poll for an increase in the budget during an opaque environment (“BearMarket”) and ask the Growth team to close deals. Sales are desperately needed. And I know it’s tough out there, but a BD team never stops closing. Regardless if it’s sunny, raining, or snowing.
