The latter is worrisome as 3F Delegate WILL ALWAYS support, in what we believe is the founding Ethos of MakerDAO, and that is to become a fully Decentralized Autonomous Organization that is fully automated and unstoppable. Since late 2018, I cannot remember a single day that I have not follow the development of both MakerDAO and the DeFi Ecosystem. More importantly, during those crypto winter days there was always unity within the MakerDAO community. It felt like something special was being built. There was always something new to learn, something new to feel excited about. We had giga-brain community members that would stimulate your mind and leave you with exhilarating thinking of the future development of MakerDAO. Those days are no longer here. It has become a power struggle between conflicting personalities that are both anonymous/pseudonymous characters, both known and unknown community members from both sides of the aisle, MKR token members who don’t participate, and servants of the DAO (Delegates, Core Units team members, etc.).  It has become a gigantic soup of gumbo that the late Anthony Bourdain would have tasted once and never recommended. It is for this reason that we choose to Abstain and do not wish to virtue signal in either direction. This Vote is no longer about the competency of the Core Unit in question, or pure analysis for the possibility that off-chain Real World Assets will never scale via MIP21. And we believe the Virtue Signaling game that is being played on this Poll is an Attack on our Party, and some might even argue… an attack on Decentralization. content.content: Thank you for the analysis and agree that the amount of “parties” and small organized supporting groups that are not fully aligned with DeFI and MakerDAO’s goal might be a growing part of the community and that in a DAO structure it will become increasingly difficult to simplify. Unfortunately though that is one of the benefits and challenges of a growing and well established DAO. Having these power struggles and conflicting personalities just proves that the DAO is working as a DAO and that at the end of the day the community decides in which direction it wants to go in. Having said that though, one thing I have noticed is the amount of different CUs that form that could roll up under a bigger CU unit. This MIP is a perfect example of that, I believe most of the community would agree that Lending Oversight’s primary objectives would be beneficial to the success of MakerDAO but that does not mean its need its own CU. This function could roll up into either the Real World Finance Unit or Strategic Finance Unit or an MIP to request an expansion of those units could be better than having siloed teams focusing on very narrow objectives. Instead expanding CU’s to incorporate new enhancements or divisions would be beneficial in terms of team collaboration, accountability, competing priorities, shared budget, among many other things. Among the better benefits of expanding CUs is that existing members and the community are able to “vet” the new member to assess their capability based on actual credentials instead of it being based on ideas, likes, comments and how active they are in the forum. Not sure this is possible today, but there should be a way to understand if the formation of a new CU would actually be better placed within an existing CU given the benefits, mentioned above.

content.content: Agree here that there is a missing piece to on-boarding newly proposed Core units. One idea is that when there is a newly proposed CU, it should be presented to an existing CU that has similar mandates, skill sets and objectives. The facilitator of that existing CU should do an evaluation of the proposed CU to determine if it should go into theirs, and if not, explain why. The key would be to not make this process a political burden or time suck for facilitators but rather an objective, standardized analysis that can be done somewhat easily and presented to the community. This would not prevent a new CU to continue to go through a process and vote, but to add some insight from mandated actors in areas where there could be CU minimization to the benefit of the DAO.

content.content: Matt_NZ:  I am quite confused about this @ElProgreso and would appreciate clarification as a long-time supporter of your work.   @matt_NZ sorry for the delayed response. But like many in this community, after more than a few sleepless nights, I needed to take  a break from the Maker Forum. I believe MakerDAO’s infinite game is to provide permissionless financial enablement for the greater good of the world. With that in mind, as an MKR Delegate I need to believe in a vision that helps this DAO accomplish a core mission that the community is passionate about. And I believe the EndGame vision is currently the best path forward. I hope the entire community, MKR token owners, and the MakerDAO Core Units will buy-in. As you know this Poll was about onboarding a Core Unit team. When thinking about how Core Units will be successful, I want to start with the Core Unit Facilitator. As mentioned in other forum post, there’s no doubt in my mind that @luca_pro has the experience for running an RWA oversight team. But as a Facilitator, we needed to break that down and see if Luca as a facilitator was virtue signaling the qualities that only a few facilitators have ever possessed in this DAO. Think Derek Flossman, LongForWisdom, David U, Payton Rose, Denis of DUX, etc. So, let’s go through a breakdown of what is the Role of a Facilitator: For REFERENCE:  Facilitator Framework   Bridge Builder: One of the strongest roles of a facilitator is to be a bridge builder between it’s Core Unit and the Community. The Facilitator must create and maintain a safe and open environment for sharing ideas. Where other people see differences, the facilitator must find and use similarities to establish a foundation for building bridges to consensus. Over the last 2-weeks, I believe the incubating LOVE CU facilitator has gotten away from building bridges. I would love to see a reset and with a focus on uniting the community.   Motivator: CU Facilitators should  ignite a fire within the community, establish momentum, and keep the pace. Over the last 2-weeks, I believe the LOVE CU facilitator has forgotten that the role of a facilitator should be to ignite the community in a positive way.   Clairvoyant: I believe that a Facilitator should watch carefully for signs of potential strain, weariness, aggravation, and disempowerment—and respond in advance to avoid dysfunctional behavior.   Peacemaker: I believe a Facilitator should to avoid a direct confrontation between participants, should such an event occur, you must quickly step in, reestablish order, and direct the group toward a constructive resolution.   A promise is a promise ( the answers to my Questions are still pending) Over the last 7-days I dove deep into the work @luca_pro has provided while incubating via SES. I read some of the recent work his Team Member @August provided to the DAO. I must admit the write-ups showcase the talent that this team has. However, I felt the author/CU team member had made an error when describing some of the components of MIP21. Hence, after reading the assessment I had some questions.  image1780×1364 153 KB  Obviously with Luca so focus on trying to get his Core Unit onboarded my Question to this day has never been answered. But that’s okay. I get it. But it’s also a “Tell” (hopefully you play poker). I don’t believe this Core Unit was structure correctly. When it was incubated, SES should have immediately identified that Luca is a Deal Maker, and not a Facilitator. With that mind, if this Vote was about the Core Unit, and not the Politics, do you really believe this Core Unit was formatted correctly? Do you want Luca to be a facilitator at a negotiation table, or do you want him to be a Closer? I believe Luca has the skillset of a closer. And the entire community including myself, and SES missed this completely. And we failed at formulating a Core Unit that is focused on doing lending oversight. If we  allowed a core unit to exist that is in the business of performing political pushes–that to me is a total Fail.

content.content: Prioritization Sentiment - Technical Resource Deployment - June 6, 2022 Kicking it off with 1st rank choice: Sagittarius Engine, all day every day. This was the original most anticipated moment in MakerDAO history that has gotten us to the EndGame–how did the Sag Engine change the game to the EndGame? Only your deep understanding and drilling down of the MetaDAO structures will ever allow you comprehend. So, get out on the frontier and understand the Endgame as oppose to opposing the one and only game changer that’s live today. 2nd rank choice: Collateral Onboarding is a no-brainer as we believe crypto tokens will continue to be influential, but will struggle to take DeFi to the promise land. The scaling of collaterals is destined to be via Real World Assets, from bonds to credit – it’ll happen somewhere in between–and with or without Maker it will be solved and it will scale. Let’s make sure Maker is not excluded. 3rd rank choice: Compound D3M –  while we are huge proponents of scaling the D3M via different DeFi platforms, we are aware that such venues like Compound might not result in the best outcome  for MKR token owners. I think there’s a huge difference between scaling products for the benefit of MKR token owners, and scaling for the benefit of DAI growth proponents. Our community needs to understand the two differential outcomes of scaling a module that benefits DAI expansion, or MKR ROI. 4th rank choice: Maker Teleport – as big proponent and believers in a cross-chain world, we believe the Maker Teleport has been a forgotten module. Could have easily been top 2, as last year I would have placed a bet that bridging was the one-thing that made the most media headlines in 2021. Boy were we wrong. Here’s to 2023 being the year.  Prioritization Sentiment - Technical Resource Deployment - June 6, 2022 1st rank choice goes to Real-World Assets Vaults, as we continue to believe that DeFi allows an opaque industry to finally have an open permissionless ledger that allows everyone to inspect and have access to real-world lending structures. This is why I believe RWAs are a game-changer and MakerDAO needs to be a pioneer of on-chain credit + debt structures. 2nd rank choice goes to Real-World Asset Arrangers, as we believe MetaDAO structures will allow RWA arrangers to compete and bring the best RWA asset management in the universe. For sure, there’s a lot of open questions how MetaDAOs will work, but I believe in due time if we keep an open mind and an endless eagerness to change the status quo–we can scale this vision 1000x. 3rd rank choice Core Crypto Collateral  the core mission of MakerDAO and never to be forgotten. We believe that crypto collateral types can only get better, but MakerDAO will continue to be selective as its become a lot more difficult to find pure decentralized crypto collateral types that can scale into the hundreds of millions.

content.content: Active Polls 3 POLLS - ENDING JUL 07 2022 16:00 UTC  Add RWA-009 (HVBank) as a new Vault Type - July 4, 2022 Voted YES and fully support this unique opportunity that allows MakerDAO to partner with a community bank who is a Pennsylvania Chartered Bank that was founded in 1871, and is currently held by HV Bancorp. Inc. (NASDAQ Listed: HVBC). We believe Huntingdon Valley Bank, along with members of the CES, RWF, incubating LTS, and PECU Core Units have done a terrific job in helping the proposed MIP6 RWA application come in full fruition. At the same token, we believe this experience has showcase the numerous iterations needed in order to make the onboarding of RWA off-chain collaterals–hopefully much easier to onboard. From instituting a DST structure, to hiring a calculation agent (Ankura), architecture of MIP21 Contacts: designing an RWAToken (ERC20 token placeholder), RWAJar (transfer any incur DAI profit to Surplus Buffer–via an CES Keeper), maintaining a Participation Funding Account via the RWA MPTrust, and other innovative ideas/thinking and moving parts. All in all this has been a challenging onboarding experience that will hopefully showcase the talent that MakerDAO and HVB have built together as partners, while innovating for this new and exciting landscape.  PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal - July 4, 2022 Voted YES to the proposed parameters changes by MOMC as we continue to see assets locked in credit protocols continue to slide. However, we agree with JP Morgan that things are starting to settle-down and, “the current deleveraging cycle may not be very protracted”, as some of the price action for the majors are reminiscent of 2019. A time when cooler heads prevailed, and the next cycle was just around the corner.  Select a Target Level of rNPI Profitability to Guide Budget Cuts - July 4, 2022 Rank Choice: Break-even (Plus-minus 5%)  – one thing that we can All agree upon is that when going through a crisis, a business needs to figure out how to keep revenue coming in, control costs, and of course–you gotta monitor the cash reserves. Unfortunately we don’t have access to CU revenue KPIs, accurate end-user churn,  opportunities (some call them a sales pipeline), and the closing rate of new opportunities (closers close). When your back is against the wall you need to get out there and make things happen. Close deals. Bring in new revenue streams. And while you wait for closers to close, you need to use methodologies such as scenario planning. And you need to be patient, and if that means breaking even–then you break even. The strategic planning question should be: what are the focal issues, external forces, and uncertainties that would lead this DAO to make cuts in Core Units and reduce the potential of Core Units to maximize closing deals? While we agree that a credit-crunch crisis is certainly here, the above deserves planning and analysis on how a potential surprise could disrupt the current strategic outlook of MakerDAO. Therefore while we wait for conditions to turn as we did during the last “crypto winter”, and we move again to “break-even”. Patience is a moral virtue.

content.content: Active Polls 6 POLLS - ENDING AUG 18 2022 16:00 UTC  Ratification Poll for Makershire Redux (MIP76) - August 8, 2022 Voted NO to a proposal that leaves a lot of questions and scenarios unanswered.   Does MakerDAO aspire to be an Investment Manager, or a decentralized lending protocol that issues over-collateralized loans? 3F Delegate advocates for the latter, and prefers that MakerDAO does NOT RUSH into being identified as an investment vehicle. However, such scenarios can play out via the Clustering of the MetaDAO structure, where certain vehicles can resemble and operate as Centralized Protector MetaDAOs. We urge the authors of this proposal to NOT RUSH Treasury Management on-behalf of MKR token owners when many questions are still unanswered.   The Question if Bridges will become subject to regulation is now an open-ended question. Will cross-chain bridges be identified as VASPs since World Regulators are now looking to combat crypto laundering? We don’t know the answers without prior guidance and therefore choose not to support this proposal since it proposes to cross 2-Centralized bridges that are looking to decentralize, but are not there yet. Let’s wait, why so much rush to experiment?   And last but not least, the Media is starting to paint this Ecosystem to the average Jane and Joe as a Clown Show. You want evidence:  The Crypto Geniuses Who Vaporized a Trillion Dollars. Everyone trusted the two guys at Three Arrows Capital. They knew what they were doing — right? Again, what’s the rush–Rome wasn’t built in a day. Everything in due time. This is more than fair to a Foundation that understands the current state of MakerDAO and also receives NO MKR bonuses. And in some regions (like the U.S.) they are doing it with what some might consider under market compensation. With a lot of Risk involved. **3F Delegate urges All MKR Token owners and Delegates to support this Rank Choice to a group of people who care and will help protect the future of MakerDAO. 2nd Ranked Choice: Bear Choice – A nice gesture by the DAI Foundation. However, we barely agree that this is necessary as our First-Choice clearly states what is the best path forward. Active Polls 2 POLLS - ENDING AUG 25 2022 16:00 UTC  Target Spend Level - August 22, 2022 1st Ranked Choice: 17 million DAI 2nd Ranked Choice: 16.5 million DAI 3rd Ranked Choice: 16 million DAI 4th Ranked Choice: 15.5 million DAI REASONING: 3F Delegate believe that without the input from CUs and a “working group” that can identify income targets, KPIs, OKRs, and accurate operating costs, it is difficult to justify a correct “Target Spend Level” that allows MKR token owners and Delegates to provide a quantitative expression of a plan for defined period of time. As we All know, such should include targeted growth volumes and revenues, resources quantities, costs and expenses, assets, liabilities and cash flow. Therefore, we believe the DAO needs to act in a way that shows intention to realize the plan. When we think about allocating budgets, the purpose should also include what resources are also necessary to help CUs achieve their intended targets. How will the DAO motivate CUs to strive to achieve budget goals and how will their performance be evaluated, and how can it provide visibility to the DAO’s future performance. This Target Level Spend Poll intends to minimize Risk to the DAO. However, it is difficult to determine such, but 3F Delegate recognizes that this DAO needs financial controls and the current spend levels are undefined. Strong financial controls will help MKR token owners have an inside window view of the numbers being reported and the financial growth of the DAO that will help protect the organization’s assets. We believe that strengthening financial controls will help the DAO monitor expenses more efficiently. Therefore, 3F Delegate chooses to initiate a lower Spend Level at 17 million DAI progressively lowering to 15.5 million DAI in order to establish for more solid financial management of the operations of MakerDAO. Originally reluctant to have the Strategic Finance CU lead the research of the Backed Finance proposal, but the current state of Real-World Finance will continue in our opinion to be non-existent until either MKR token owners choose the path forward with a New RWF Core Unit, or the Endgame State is chosen as the best path forward. Since the best path forward for RWAs is currently undetermined, 3F Delegate believes SFCU is the best available option to help MakerDAO understand RWA products that are starting to be tokenized by the likes of Blackrock, State Street, Itaú Unibanco from Brasil, and many others from across the Globe. However, there will be many different types of implementations for the tokenization of RWAs–and it is extremely important that MakerDAO does not get left behind. As the original visionary of bringing RWAs on-chain and to the forefront of Blockchain Technology, it is important that MakerDAO explore and invest in the innovative future for the tokenization of RWAs. 3F Delegate moves to support this SPF request.

content.content: Active Polls 3 POLLS - ENDING SEP 19 2022 16:00 UTC  Community Greenlight Poll - GUNIV3-BUSD-DAI (Gelato Uniswap v3 BUSD-DAI) - September 5, 2022 Voted NO as we struggle to see how without the strategic involvement by Binance in helping increase the Volume of BUSD on Ethereum, this G-UNI token will gain any traction and overcome the Cost to run this Collateral Type. The current TVL of Uniswap v3 for the BUSD/DAI LP is $21.90K. On Arrakis Vaults the BUSD/DAI vault has a TVL of $536.74. Unfortunately this collateral type has failed to scale. More importantly, 3F Delegate struggles to see any how BUSD will gain any traction on the Ethereum Ecosystem, when the largest Stablecoin provider in the World, Tether–struggles to gain acceptance versus USDC in this said ecosystem. So, how in the world will this Gelato LP token generate at least 30M DAI. We don’t see it–and choose to Poll, NO.  Community Greenlight Poll - GAMMA UNI-V3-WBTC-RENBTC (Gamma Uniswap v3 wBTC-renBTC) - September 5, 2022 Voted NO – It feels like 10-years have passed-by since the Ren Team promised to decentralized their virtual nodes (“DarkNodes”)  via progressive decentralization, yet here we are in 2022 and the core team still maintains control of its nodes. In fact, the roadmap I used to personally follow returns a 404 error. Indeed–perhaps some things have changed since I last followed the project closely as I once did, but the lack of product traction and lack of network effects is still evident. Even then, ignoring my rant–the proposed Uni-v3 LP token does not possess the attributes and qualities required to become a successful MakerDAO Collateral Type.  This is evident by the onboarding of the RENBTC-A Vault which is currently producing 0.04% of the outstanding DAI. This vault has not led to either an increase in Revenue and DAI growth. With TVL of $10.17M on UNI-v3 – 3F Delegates believes Daily Volume and TVL needs to at least 10x in order to be consider as a MakerDAO collateral type. Unfortunately at this time and point, there’s just too much liquidity risk, demand risk, and some will argue that there is regulatory risk. With the former being clearly evident, and not enough proof that this collateral type will Generate at least 30M DAI annually, we choose to Poll for NO.  Community Greenlight Poll - GNO (GnosisDAO) - September 5, 2022 Voted YES as this is the only MIP6 application that has the potential to generate 30M DAI over the next 12-months and it needs to be further investigated by the MakerDAO teams via the Greenlight Collateral Index. Gnosis has a vast Treasury ($300M++) ranging from ETH to COMP. It is also proposing to rebrand its marquee product, xDAI to DAI. This is something that MakerDAO needs to investigate further. The last pass this community made was not acquiring the xDAI Chain, and allowing it to ride off into the sunset with someone else. Let’s not take another pass on an opportunity that can possibly lead to network effects via xDAI. We choose to vote YES and hope other MKR token owners and Delegates will Greenlight this MIP6 application.

Such MetaDAOs include a “Results Guarantee system” that will provide GovernorDAOs with “overhead fees on top of the base budgets that are paid to the Decentralized Workforce.” And after further review of the proposed compensation structure via MIP78, and the proposed Endgame Plan which involves delegates, councils, facilitators, and tribunals, it is best to consider a compensation structure that does not lead to unequal pay and a pecking order that negates complete development and self-actualization. Change PSM-GUSD-A Parameters - October 10, 2022 Voted YES for the proposed parameters changes, increase tout DC from 60M to 500M, and the target available debt from 10M to 50M–all in support of a very exciting proposal that has been presented to the MakerDAO community by Gemini Trust Company, LLC. Per SFCU the tout increase from 0 to 20 bips should mitigate arb opportunities by bots, but I suspect this will need to be revisited and perhaps increase a bit higher to discourage such.  End DAI Funding For Sourcecred - October 10, 2022 This is a tough one here. As someone who was inspired by the community, learned from the community, and who aspired early on to be apart of the community, without the need for, or existence of SourceCred, it does feel like this powerful tool has run its course. However, I do remember the days when SourceCred was introduced and it made me realized that governance mining incentivizes were possible. And such tooling allowed community participants to build a reputation (“Cred + Grain”) that I believed could be used as an DID (Decentralized Identity). So, it breaks my heart to see SourceCred get abused. The plethora of Forum accounts that are created  for abusive purposes is just overwhelming. They don’t add value, and some are keen to “game” SourceCred. But then I think of the forward visionaries. The Ceramic’s of this ecosystem, the Disco Data Dating credential DID builders, the Gitcoin Passport identifiers, and so many more that I have probably never heard of–and I realize that quitting on SourceCred is an easy way out. It’s done, it had its heyday in the limelight–so, let’s quit. But we are not quitters. We are innovators. And with innovation comes great visions. But, so was America Online. And it breaks my heart to admit that SourceCred is the AOL of Governance Mining. Therefore, we sadly move to vote YES to ending SourceCred.  MOMC Guidance - Remove ETH Supply Yield And Liquidity Incentives From D3M Target Borrow Rate Calculations - October 10, 2022 Voted YES as season’s change, yields change and AAVE’s ETH supply rates for sure change and it makes it difficult for the D3M to stay competitive with the current parameters (Proposed Nov. 2021). Therefore, it makes sense to remove the ETH supply yield and liquidity incentives from calculations when MOMC needs to recommend the Target Borrow Rate (bar). In the current environment, the old calculations are as old as aunt Mabel.  MOMC Guidance - Allowed Spread Between D3M Target Borrow Rate And ETH-A Stability Fee October 10, 2022 Assuming the first Poll is successful: Option 1:  0.5% Spread, bar at 2% with 90M DC and the possibility of 680M DAI in revenue per annum assuming current forward market rates. Option 2:  0% Spread, 'bar" at 1.5% with 105M DC and the possibility of 730M DAI in revenue oer annum assuming current forward market rates. As the protocol looks to restart the D3M these are good mid-market data points to help the MOMC gauge the spread between the D3M target borrow rate parameters and the ETH-A stability fee.

Therefore, 3F Delegate supports the Endgame pre-launch MIP Set as it believes it will add human value, while uninstalling bureaucracy and building better structures and systems around this new human centric paradigm, called MetaDAOs.

This FTX moment shows the dangers of Centralized Finance, and the ecosystem’s unconcerned for taking an initiative to educate end-users, developing user-friendly tools–that unfortunately has led users to prefer to hold their tokens on Exchanges–while avoiding the need to interact directly with the blockchain. It saddens me–we must do better and avoid serious uncertainties, and maybe disasters that will end the dream of a DeFi ecosystem. We move to support.

We believe the Immunefi CU is best suited in the MetaDAO Economy as an Ecosystem Actor that will compete against other Ecosystem Actors to provide services. We look forward to seeing more contributions from community member Josh Pritkin via the Endgame Plan.  Budget Ratification Poll for Modify Development and UX Core Unit (DUX-001) Budget (MIP40c3-SP82) - November 14, 2022 Voted YES – Over the next 12-months the DUX CU will play an important role in the pregame stage of the Endgame and will be a premier catalyst in building and designing the game-changing front-ends. We believe the amount of workload this team will incur needs to be budgeted at the highest level. Therefore, we urge All MKR token owners to support this super-talented team by keeping them at, “Business as Usual” EDIT:  1st RANKED-CHOICEPreference for a NewBase Budget at 1,611,420 DAI as primary choice. It allows for a less expensive expansion of DUX, while saving 200K, and allowing DUX to deliver–versus “business as usual” budget request. 2nd RANKED-CHOICE:  Approve existing budget only (Business as usual): 1,871,300 DAI  Ratification Poll for CoinShares Active Treasury Management (MIP86) - November 14, 2022 Voted NO as there’s no need to onboard another provider of Treasury Management and the current opaque market environment does not play favorably for centralized actors that have exposure to crypto related assets. Also, MakerDAO should not take on further counterparty risk with an entity that carries a balance sheet with Total Assets of $1.9B and Total Liabilities of ($1.6B). Therefore, we cannot support this proposal and ask CoinShares to consider revisiting the protector MetaDAOs structures as a possible means to work with this DAO.  Ratification Poll for OUSD Decentralized Rewards (MIP87) - November 14, 2022 Voted NO – Origin protocol has tremendous ambition to create global Network Effects with OUSD and has shown continuous resilience when needing to survive bear markets. However, we believe the timing is not right as the Endgame Scopes (TBD) will more than likely not require the need to add rewards of a Governance Token like OGN. Perhaps one day if the Endgame Scopes requires adding this type of asset class via a Creator MetaDAO, or as an ecosystem actor–Origin Protocol can then provide value-added services to the Endgame Plan. Otherwise, we want to say thank you to the Origin team for this proposal and ask that they stay resilient. Onward and upward!  Ratification Poll for Modify Immunefi Security Core Unit (IS-001) Mandate (MIP39c2-SP38) - November 14, 2022 Voted NO as the Endgame Plan calls for Ecosystem Actors to provide services to both Clusters, and to future MetaDAOs. We believe the Immunefi CU is best suited in the MetaDAO Ecosystem as an Ecosystem Actor that will compete against other Ecosystem Actors to provide services.  Budget Ratification Poll for Modify Immunefi Security (IS-001) Budget (MIP40c3-SP83) - November 14, 2022 Voted: REJECT BUDGET as the Endgame Plan calls for Ecosystem Actors to provide services to both Clusters and MetaDAOs. We believe the Immunefi CU is well suited in the MetaDAO Ecosystem as an Ecosystem Actor that will compete against other Ecosystem Actors to provide services.  Budget Ratification Poll for Modify Governance Communications Core Unit DAI Budget, COM-001 (MIP40c3-SP84) - November 14, 2022 Voted REJECT BUDGET as the Endgame Plan calls for Ecosystem Actors to provide services to both Clusters and  MetaDAOs. We believe COM-001 is well suited in the MetaDAO Economy as an Ecosystem Actor that will provide Governance Communication services to DVCs, incubating Clusters, MetaDAOs, and perhaps even Councils, Tribunals, and Delegates can hire this team for comm services. COM-001 can also use project-based funding for the benefit of educating the community on what exactly is the Endgame Plan (desperately needed). While we believe COM-001 has provided a valuable service as a Core Unit, COM-001 is best suited as an ecosystem actor in the MetaDAO Ecosystem.  Budget Ratification Poll for Modify Sidestream Auction Services Core Unit DAI Budget, SAS-001 (MIP40c3-SP85) - November 14, 2022 Voted REJECT BUDGET as the Endgame Plan during the pregame calls for less Core Units and instead for more Ecosystem Actors that can provide services to both Clusters and MetaDAOs. We are under the believe that SAS-001 is best suited in the MetaDAO Economy as an Ecosystem Actor that will also compete against other service providers. This will allow the MetaDAO ecosystem to encourage competition–although we expect SAS-001 to be 10-steps ahead of other competitors.  Budget Ratification Poll for Modify TechOps Core Unit DAI Budget, TECH-001 (MIP40c3-SP86) - November 14, 2022 Voted APPROVED BUDGET although this Core Unit should be moving to the Endgame as an ecosystem actor and eventually competing with other service providers. If you cut out their budget you will leave some of the Core CUs scrambling to put-out fires, as opposed to focusing on the pregame. There are also many DAO assets that are dependent of TechOps. We look forward to seeing the Endgame decentralize any central points of control that TechOps is currently controlling.  Ratification Poll for Modify Emulated Surplus Buffer Upper Limit (MIP84c10-SP1) - November 14, 2022 Voted NO as we believe there is an urgency to accumulate decentralized collateral and the POVE is designed to help MakerDAO accumulate a collateral that is permissionless, decentralized, and trustless via the Endgame Plan. As ETH fulfills this requirement, we are excited to see the launch of the POVE and believe the MIP 84 proposed upper limit is a good starting point.  Therefore, we vote to reject this ratification of MIP84.  Ratification Poll for Monetalis - Redwood Friesian (MIP88) - November 14, 2022 Voted YES to what will be known as  the Viridian Cluster and proposer of MIP88 for the on-boarding of a DAI 225M RWA vault that will acquire USDC via the PSM. More importantly–we believe there’s a need to diversify the USDC that has accumulated in the PSM and the Viridian cluster is proposing to acquire super senior AAA rated RMBS via a similar legal structure of the Monetalis Clydesdale (MIP65). We believe MIP88 and MIP89 will both adapt to the changing economic environment. Budget Ratification Poll for Modify the Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling Core Unit DAI Budget, SES-001 (MIP40c3-SP87) - November 14, 2022 RANK CHOICE: Approve speedy operations platform option budget: 3,199,200 DAI streamed over twelve months. content.content: Change of Vote Notification on ADDING GNO as a new Vault Type     flipflopflapdelegate:  Add GNO (GnosisDAO) as a new Vault Type - November 21, 2022   Changing this Poll Vote to YES based on this agreement by the Growth Core Unit and GnosisDAO. 3F Delegate is a proponent of adding more ETH/StakedETH as collateral types. As the DAO moves into the Pregame, and eventually the EarlyGame–it is essential that the protocol attracts more decentralized collateral. Between the traveling to EthGathering, the FTX debacle, and our focus on the Endgame plan, the Agreement was lost in translation.

Change of Vote Notification: REJECTING the current TechOps Budget Request After further review and weeks of speaking to Core Unit Facilitators and Team Members that are engaged with TechOps, it is evident that some CUs are not satisfied with the quality of services provided by TechOps, and other CUs are HIGHLY dependent of the services provided by TechOps. It is also evident that some CUs will be moving away from using TechOps and will be looking for other Ecosystem Actors that can provide customer services that meet expectations. While some CUs are dependent of TechOps and we recognize that not approving the current budget can lead to distractions in the roll-out phase of the Pregame, there’s no reason why TechOps can’t comeback with a LOWER Budget request in the next two (2) months and make the proper adjustments necessary to service those Core Units that seem adamant about retaining the services of TechOps. We also don’t want to shy away from our previous reasoning. We had asked that we avoid putting Core Units under pressure to make adjustments in a world with a low TechOps budget. However, we have come to the final conclusion that TechOps can adjust their Budget accordingly and for Core Units to make the proper adjustments for the benefit of MakerDAO. Furthermore, if we support this Budget we are sending out a message that other CUs should not adjust their budgets accordingly to both the Endgame Plan and the current Bear Market. We ask @simonkp and the TechOps team to reassess the Budget Request and adjust to the current Bear Market Environment and how Core Units will be using their services going forward (some have said they will no longer need the services of TechOps). As @simonkp already understands, the Endgame Plan calls for this CU to phase-out into an Ecosystem Actor. Therefore, it is important the the proper adjustments be made now rather than later.

content.content: Hello @simonkp Thank you for asking for this constructive feedback, and I really appreciate you publicly reaching out and asking 3F Delegate for feedback.  While having a Core Unit budget rejected is no easy thing to accept—we want you to know that it was a tough decision to vote No to the TechOps Budget request—and ask that your team members come back stronger, diligently, and involved more than ever. 3F Delegate believes that the DAO was evenly split between the satisfaction and dissatisfaction with TechOps performance, the services rendered, the steep budget ask during this bear market, and the Endgame pivot—which we believe will eliminate over 80% of Core Units over the next 6 months. With regards to CUs and Recognized Delegates that have expressed their discontent w/TechOps to 3F Delegate either discreetly in person, or discreetly via the Metaverse—I don’t have a word for word recollection of how it was verbally expressed, but I will try my best to explain it. Again, their discontent was provided discreetly and 3F Delegate will respect their discretionary disclosures.  Unsatisfactory Performance With that understanding—some CUs quickly come to mind as being discreet about their displeasure with both the monetary charges incurred/quoted, offering of services at excessive price rates, and the expected customer services that allegedly were not delivered by TechOps:   A certain CU felt offended by the TechOps offer to charge money for services related to a certain MakerDAO asset that TechOps controls and was previously owned by the Foundation. Again, I don’t have a word for word verbal recollection—but hearing this gives the impression that TechOps has a strong-hold and position on the DAO based on the numerous assets TechOps allegedly controls. While we understand business is business—I can also tell you that once some of the Recognized Delegates got a whim of this—they were unhappy—particularly because some do not welcome what we call “double-dipping” as a business practice.   Vocal discontent by certain team members of a CU that TechOps has at times failed to deliver on the services rendered (and at a steep price), which became an immediate displeasure to some Delegates. Stories of such CU having to take action in the middle of the night, while your team was unaware of the need to take action related to services that TechOps should render diligently, and is paid for (again, unsatisfactory to some delegates).   Furthermore, Delegates have been communicated by such CU that in-the-near future TechOps services will no longer be needed—such CU intends to run such services internally. While this might have not been communicated to TechOps during the budget RFC period—some Delegates believe that:   A. The Endgame Plan calls for TechOps to become an Ecosystem Actor.   B. There is no need for TechOps to budget for certain services since the Endgame has been accepted by MKR token owners and it is best for TechOps to reapply with a lower budget.   Other Opinions by some of the Recognized Delegates:   3F Delegate is under the impression that some recognized delegates believe TechOps is no longer needed. Each CU that will remain with the Core (ex., PECU, Risk, Growth) can run their own nodes(PE as an example), GovAlpha/Future Governance MetaDAOs should hire you as an Ecosystem Actor, or step-up and run Discord/Forums on their own,   other CUs like DUX need to also step-up and take care of basic web-2 duties that they believe you are delivering and charging DUX for. While other Delegates believe TechOps is necessary, but have a preference for a much lower budget and Core Units to become self-sufficient.   Perhaps some Delegates might not understand the complexity of the services TechOps offers — however, we believe it is the responsibility of TechOps to communicate such complex services to the greater community.   Disclosure: a major Recognized Delegate was also 10-minutes away from changing their Vote to NO before expiry of the Budget Poll (they were unable to pull the trigger—with ample time they would have).    Satisfactory Performance   A certain CU is super dependent of your services and more than satisfied. They were vocal in defending the need for TechOps—however, they did not want to comment on your budget ask — although such opinion was not asked for…   Another CU who is also super dependent of your services—believe that in the upcoming pivot to the Endgame—TechOps will be pivotal in helping deploy certain end-user services—particularly during the Pregame. However, they were also not eager to comment on your budget request, even though they were not ask for such commentary. All-in-all, we got the idea your services are highly appreciated by certain CUs but the HIGH budget ask is something that both MKR token owners  and even outsiders should question.   Another CU welcomes and appreciates your services—however, certain delegates have express their displeasure of such CU not taking on simple tasks like running and taking full ownership of certain applications, and when the Facilitators of such CU were pressed—they acknowledge that they are able, willing, and ready. Hence, this further sold some Delegates on the idea that TechOps is not needed—because CUs can step-up and “self-custody” certain DAO assets.   Other CUs were neutral — some Facilitators that are more technical of these neutral CUs might have expressed that some of the services you offer can easily be duplicated. But I might be forgetting detailed, good, and constructive criticism—so please forgive me, I have provided what I can recall.    Final Thoughts All-in-all I can tell you that one thing you could do better is to communicate better with the Community on what you are delivering, why you are charging DAI for such services, and why the services of TechOps are important and valued at the budget ask that you submitted. One thing I learned about communities is that you must be involved—in order for the community to understand—why you are necessary and more importantly, why you are needed. I hope that helps Simon. 3F Delegate believes that TechOps is valuable. But in what capacity—remains a question mark since we believe you’ll need to cluster  as an Ecosystem Actor. We believe this pivot will allow TechOps  to blossom without the bureaucracy that it is currently under. I also totally understand how this must be frustrating. But we know that you are resilient and believe TechOps is a big part of this DAO. We ask that TechOps keeps pushing forward. Again, thanks for allowing 3F to comment. If you have any questions, or concerns please email 3F Delegate via the forum in order to avoid spamming this thread. All the best, Flip Flop Flap Delegate LLC

content.content: Active Polls 3 POLLS - ENDING DEC 01 2022 16:00 UTC  DAI Savings Rate Adjustment - November 28, 2022 Voted for an increase of 50 basis points based on the preference for: A.  More accumulation of decentralized collateral via stakedETH/ETH via the introduction of the POVE and ETHDAI. 3F Delegate believes that any excess surplus should be focused on the accumulation of  more decentralized collateral, preferably ETH/StakedETH–versus short-term thinking in a very opaque market environment.  While cranking-up the DSR for the benefit of DAI holders is important, the current Crypto Winter can last many years (with an “s”) and this community should be thinking about how to survive and push-forward on building-out the Endgame Plan ecosystem. B. The DSR should be automated(this will take time away from other important work related to the Endgame Pivot), it should be analyzed, the risk parameters should be fine-tuned, and the protocol should become profitable before offering a DSR that will be taken seriously by large DAI holders and future large users. Unfortunately, increasing the DSR to even 1% will not create any mass usage of DAI, as the FTX debacle will linger in the minds of people for many years to come. We move to support a 50 basis points DSR increase as a case-study for having a conversation on how  to properly build this product as a future lever for the Endgame Plan.  PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal - November 28, 2022 Supporting here increasing the wStakedETH line–as mentioned before–we are proponents of increasing ETH-based collateral in the system–and we support lowering the line for wBTC–long overdue.  Undertake Necessary Risk and Legal Assessments to Increase the NS-DROP Debt Ceiling to 50 Million DAI - November 28, 2022 Voted YES as we have waited for a log-time for the introduction of the Trust Indenture as an RWA legal structure that should benefit MakerDAO token-holders . 3F supports an assessment for this structure that should represent the best interests of MKR token owners, and also assess and define the role of the indenture trustee–who will be pivotal in making sure New Silver complies with the terms of the trust indenture. While we are excited about putting the long-awaited Trust Indenture into play–we are also supporters of increasing the DC of the New Silver Vault to 50M–as we believe this borrower has cautiously navigated Vault utility, paying SFs, they understand the importance of having a Junior Tranche (TIN/DROP Token, 20/80), and also providing MakerDAO a fair Stability Fee of 4.5%. All-in-all, many in the community have been satisfied and surprised how well New Silver has played in the RWA sandbox. We move to support and vote Yes.

Dai Foundation Board Member Election Poll - December 12, 2022 This was a tough choice as both candidates are super talented and posses the skills that are beneficially important in the services of the Dai Foundation, which are to provide a safe haven and protect Maker IP, including the DAI and MakerDAO trademarks. content.content: Active Polls 15 POLLS - ENDING JAN 23 2023 16:00 UTC  Ratification Poll for MIP63 Maker Keeper Network Amendment (MIP4c2-SP31) - January 9, 2023 Voted YES – we agree and support the change form a 6-month keeper network budgets to a maximum duration of 2 years for keeper network budgets, as well as the requested modifications to the MIP63c4 template and the reporting of both payments and budgets. We like this idea for any excess DAI being returned to the surplus buffer.   Ratification Poll for Defense Fund (MIP55c3-SP14) - January 9, 2023 Voted an absolutely YES in order to kickstart the idea of funding a “defense fund” that will attempt to protect MakerDAO core team members. One thing that we believe, is that everyone has the right to due process and should have the ability to be represented by the best representation available. Furthermore, we believe this proposed program can be expanded to a project like Nexus, or MKR token owners can opt to explore the reinsurance markets. We also understand that amount requested (5M DAI) will always be controlled by MakerDAO Governance, and this “defense fund” can be used as the first tranche for the protection of Maker’s Core Unit team members. We believe that in order for an MKR token owner to not believe this fund is desperately needed, they’re more than likely not fully digesting the proposal and the desperate need for MakerDAO core contributors to be protected. We believe that the author and the team behind this proposal spent countless hours and did a lot of research for different options that MakerDAO could have explored. Therefore, we are confident after meeting the author at many conferences that they were dedicated in researching as well as asking the right questions to many legal experts in order to generate this proposal. Thank you to @layerzero and team for their hardwork and dedication. We move to support this desperately needed proposal.  Ratification Poll for Onboard PSM USDC to Yearn to earn Yield (MIP92) - January 9, 2023 Voted YES – there’s a need to outsource certain decentralized opportunities, as this protocol is currently inundated with centralized counterpart party proposals. If this proposal is rejected and MKR token owners believes that the Core of MakerDAO will deploy the same strategies as quickly as the Yearn Finance team, we have Igloos in Guadalajara, Mexico to sell you. As we all know, deploying anything via Maker Governance is an extremely excruciating process. If we believe that these decentralized strategies can be timed perfectly when DeFi yields comeback and are favorable, odds are MakerDAO will miss-the-boat. Because by the time Maker Governance decides to internally deploy such, it will be too late to get involved. MakerDAO Governance is slow as a snail.  On the other hand, we are not enjoying the proposed structure fee of 20%. We ask the author @corn and the Yearn team to reconsidered the proposed fee of 20%, and aligning it to a more feasible structure that MKR token owners will unanimously approve.  Ratification Poll for Declaration of Intent to Develop a Comprehensive On-chain Monitoring Solution for RWA Vaults (MIP13c3-SP13) - January 9, 2023 Voted YES as we believe the MakerDAO community has been desperately asking for an on-chain RWA monitoring solution since EthDenver 2022. Since, then as things move slowly in MakerDAO–there has been not much of an effort, outside of some nice Dune dashboards by folks like Seb and others. We move to support.  Ratification Poll for Onboard-Amend Keeper Network - Chainlink Automation (MIP63c4-SP5) - January 9, 2023 Voted YES for the addition of Chainlink Automation contract to the Maker Keeper network. This can be a nice addition to the Endgame, once Creator subDAOs get rolling.  Ratification Poll for Special Purpose Fund for developing Proof-of-Performance for Viridian Cluster (MIP55c3-SP13) - January 9, 2023 Voted YES in support of the Viridian Cluster request for funding for the addition of team members, such as a PM, Compliance/legal lead, and a credit/risk lead. This funding is also needed in order to get MIP88 across the finish line and for the expansion of MIP65. You can’t have a quality Endgame Cluster if funding is not available. As Endgame supporters, we move to support the Viridian Cluster.  Ratification Poll for Commercial Risk and Legal Domain Work to Support SF-001 Expanded Mandate Related to RWAs (MIP55c3-SP12) - January 9, 2023 Voted YES – we had the privilege of meeting via Zoom with the proposed structure-finance consultant @roo and can’t say enough about how impressed we were. This is a Gem of a discovery and many Thanks to Strategic Finance for this addition. And it’s not just Flip Flop Flap Delegate that believes this, we have spoken with many that feel the same. We move to support.  Ratification Poll for Protocol DAI Transfer to Fund IS-001 from Dec 2022 to May 2023 (MIP14c2-SP2) - January 9, 2023 We totally support and Vote YES to expanding IS-001 to May 2023 as the pregame of the Endgame might not have further traction in midyear.  Ratification Poll for Requesting Protocol DAI Transfer to fund TechOps CU for February 2023 (MIP14c2-SP1) - January 9, 2023 Absolutely YES – we believe TechOps has improved its communication to the community, as well as understanding how to budget during this “crypto winter.” There was never any doubt that this team will always be needed, and we are thankful that they have taken both the criticisms and advice from the community as an inspiration to deliver quality to MakerDAO. We move to support.  Ratification Poll for Core Unit Off-boarding (COM-001) (MIP39c3-SP7) - January 9, 2023 This proposal got off to a rocky start as it was confusing and the fact MakerDAO does not have a guide for providing a severance package to outgoing contributors made it that much more difficult to satisfy both GovComms and some community members. While some MKR owners and community members will probably not agree that any of the requested “Golden Parachute” options are deserved by this Core Unit, we did a lot of soul searching and realized that the facilitator @Davidutro, Artem and the rest of the part-time contributors have dedicated themselves to the Maker community. Specifically David U who we believe should have received MKR from the inception of his Core Unit and decided delay such in order to prove his good intentions. We have seen David U participate in this community since his Foundation days, and blossom into a dedicated MakerDAO community member. Therefore, we believe that he deserves the following options: (Rank-choice Poll)1ST CHOICE: Approve Offboarding, 60,700 DAI Golden Parachute and 100% Multiplier for retroactive MKR - additional 107,317.50 DAI (CU-preferred) (Rank-choice)2ND CHOICE: Approve Offboarding, 60,700 DAI Golden Parachute and 80% Multiplier for retroactive MKR - additional 85,854 DAI And last but not least, we hope David, Artem, and the rest of the contributors will continue to help this DAO move onward and upward in its quest to deploy the Endgame Constitution.  Ratification Poll for Remove MIP14c4 (Protocol DAI Transfer Ceiling) (MIP4c2-SP32) - January 9, 2023 Voted YES – with the delay of the Endgame rollout to the “mid-game” in 2023 it is important that this DAI Transfer Ceiling be removed in order to support the upcoming request for SPFs by Ecosystem Actors that will be needed accordingly. It’s time to get rid of the Cap and support this Ratification.  Ratification Poll for Obsolete MIP Removal (MIP23, MIP28) (MIP4c4-SP3) - January 9, 2023 Voted YES for the deprecation of these MIPs that no longer serve a purpose.  Ratification Poll for MIP14 Repeal (MIP4c4-SP2) - January 9, 2023 Voted NO – MIP 14 fills the void when SPFs(MIP55) and MIP40 (Budget sub-proposal) can’t be used. This proposal had good intentions, but because of the Endgame and the possibility that the rollout will be delayed, it will hamper the ability for Ecosystem Actors to continue to support the DAO.  Ratification Poll for Amend MIP51 to Remove MIP51c4 (Calendar Exceptions) (MIP4c2-SP28) - January 9, 2023 Voted NO – MIP51c4 is a calendar exception for the Monthly Governance Cycle in December. Flip Flop Flap Delegate is an LLC made in America and we respect the observance of cultural and religious holidays, as well as protecting the mental health of our Core Unit Team members. Therefore, we ask for a better written proposal that defines emergency parameters more clearly. We also believe team members are aware that an emergency is possible during the December Governance cycle.  Ratification Poll for Amend MIP61 to tighten up Recognized Delegate Participation Metrics (MIP4c2-SP29) - January 9, 2023 1ST and only Choice: Approve both Voted for Approved Both - Flip Flop Flap Delegate is a dedicated MakerDAO Delegate Platform that believes in the attempt to Abstain on rare occasions, and we believe that Communication should be done at the same time as your platform submits the on-chain Vote. Rarely do we Communicate in less than 15-minutes of submitting the on-chain Vote. We highly recommend that everyone works in this capacity, vote & communicate simultaneously.

content.content: Active Polls 2 POLLS - ENDING JAN 19 2023 16:00 UTC  Adjust the GUSD PSM Debt Ceiling - January 16, 2023 While the community appreciates the forum update provided by Gemini, and the post stated that “Gemini is audited on an annual basis by Deloitte”, Flip Flop Flap Delegate would have preferred an end-of-year 2022 audit published and made available to MKR token owners. The community has been provided GUSD attestations. But as we all know, there is a difference between Attestations, Assurance, and Auditing. The latter is performed to discover data, risks, or compliance issues. Being that Gemini is not a Publicly Traded Company and is not required to publish 3rd party audits–gauging the health factor of Gemini without audits performed by an independent public accountant during this difficult economic environment is an opaque task. And when risk factors are opaque, it is difficult for MKR token owners to Govern the Protocol diligently. Furthermore, we would have appreciated an analysis on how MakerDAO can redeem GUSD in case of insolvency. We are left with many unanswered questions and therefore, we move to Poll in the following ranking order: 1st Rank Choice: Decrease to 0 DAI. 2nd Rank Choice: Decrease to 100 million DAI.  Decrease GUSD PSM Fee Out (tout) - January 16, 2023 Voted YES to reducing the PSM-GUSD-A Fee Tout to zero, as this will help ecosystem actors avoid the fees associated with removing GUSD from the PSM.

content.content: Active Polls 1 POLL - ENDING FEB 16 2023 16:00 UTC  Ratification Poll for Restart a daily $100 Micro-Burn of MKR in Show of Good Faith to MKR Holders (MIP74c1-SP1) - February 13, 2023 Flip Flop Flap Delegate LLC Voted NO – Although we joined and committed to MakerDAO due to the burning of MKR, we have encountered a liquidity problem associated with the token. Large MKR holders can potentially manipulate the system, which limits community growth. To address this issue, the introduction of the Endgame offers unique surplus distribution methods to attract new MKR owners. Several ideas have been proposed to increase liquidity for MKR, and we believe that a new Surplus mechanism can benefit both new and existing token holders.  Active Polls 4 POLLS - ENDING FEB 27 2023 16:00 UTC  Ratification Poll - Declaration of Intent - Implement a Feature to Refund People who Lost Money Sending Dai to the Dai Contract Address (MIP13c3-SP14) - February 13, 2023 Flip Flop Flap Delegate LLC Voted NO - We believe that implementing this feature via the DssCure module would require engineering work to develop a merkle tree distribution contract, and such resources should be used to tackle other pending work. Additionally, the contract would need to be audited and the social contract of DAI redemption needs to be agreed upon by MKR token owners (including fees, ETH gas costs, minimum redemption, etc.). This would consume significant resources that could otherwise be used to develop MakerDAO’s proposed products, such as ETHDAI (long overdue). However, we recognize the need for an improved end-user experience for interacting with DAI and suggest discussing the possibility of removing the End module, which some consider an obstacle.  Ratification Poll for Amend MIP62 to Allow for Changing Communication Responsibilities (MIP4c2-SP33) - February 13, 2023 Flip Flop Flap Delegate LLC Voted YES – we are hopeful that adding this responsibility to GovAlpha-Core-Unit via component MIP62c5 will lead to great communication coordination and that GovAlpha will onboard someone who is more than qualified without the Vote of MKR token owners. This leads to less bureaucracy, so GovAlpha needs to step up and prove that they can get the job done right.  Ratification Poll for Amend Interim Facilitator Appointment Process (MIP4c2-SP30) - February 13, 2023 Flip Flop Flap Delegate LLC Voted YES – As proponents of cutting out bureaucracy, we support these amendments which  include changes to MIP41c3, MIP41c6, and the addition of MIP41c7. The key changes include limiting the number of Interim Facilitators to one, allowing Governance Facilitators to modify the appointment process to suit circumstances, and specifying the responsibilities and compensation of Interim Facilitators. Additionally, the amendment details a process for handling edge cases and acknowledges the reduced input of Maker Governance in the Interim Facilitator selection process. The proposed changes aim to improve continuity and speed while maintaining transparency and integrity. Therefore, we move to support.  Ratification Poll for $100M of Cogent Bank Loan Participations (MIP95) - February 13, 2023 Flip Flop Flap Delegate LLC Voted NO – while we believe Cogent is more than likely a good U.S. Bank and they perform good loans, unfortunately the timing of this application has three hurdles. The first hurdle, MakerDAO is currently focused on finding highly liquid assets such as U.S. Treasuries with a senior position that can be redeemed easily. This proposal is looking to participate in various types of commercial loans, including commercial and industrial loans, CRE land and development loans, CRE non-owner occupied loans, CRE owner-occupied loans, life insurance loans, consumer and other loans, specialty lending, SBA guaranteed loans, residential lending, and public finance. Second, if the MakerDAO Constitution is passed by MKR token owners, it calls for the implementation of the RWA scope framework through management of arrangers and asset managers, direct exposure to stablecoins, and high-yield real-world asset exposure. The framework also covers principles and requirements related to “clean money,” including the prohibition of direct funding of coal electricity production and ensuring that Real World Asset collateral is allocated based only on risk-adjusted returns. These qualifications  and the definition of high-yield RWA exposure are yet to be determined by MKR token owners. And third, we are currently witnessing the recent regulatory actions taken by U.S. regulators to limit the exposure of traditional banks to the risks associated with the cryptocurrency industry. The Federal Reserve and other agencies have rejected applications from crypto-focused banks and have cautioned traditional banks against working with crypto companies.  Therefore, the regulatory uncertainty alone is strong reasoning to reject this proposal. We ask Cogent to revisit this partnership at a later date, and thank them along with MaxStability LLC for this application.

content.content: Active Polls 2 POLLS - ENDING FEB 23 2023 16:00 UTC  Audit and Review Work for Phoenix Labs - February 20, 2023 Voted YES – In order to continue leading the DeFi revolution, MakerDAO needs to continuously innovate and improve the protocol. This is where supporting the immediate scope outlined by PECU for this Poll is a prudent requirement that should be supported by MKR token owners. We believe by reviewing the Aave v3 fork, as well as the new interest rate mechanics as part of Spark Lend, will allow MakerDAO to stay up-to-date with the latest developments in the DeFi space and incorporate them diligently. By doing so, MakerDAO will be able to open a brand new window that will provide DeFi users with new products. This Audit and Review will help to ensure that the protocol continues to evolve and adapt to changing market conditions and user needs. Moreover, a technical assessment of the Spark Lend initiative, is crucial to ensure that any integration with the D3M are secure and reliable. This will help to prevent any potential security breaches or system failures, which could harm the protocol’s reputation and the trust that users have in it. Additionally, the resubmission to ChainSecurity pending any code changes is important for ensuring the code used in the integration is thoroughly tested and audited to ensure it meets high standards of security and reliability.  Engineering Resource for Phoenix Labs - February 20, 2023 Voted YES – The Phoenix Labs initiative, which is based on the Spark Protocol, has the potential to help future subDAOs scale, and this can benefit the entire MakerDAO ecosystem. By dedicating a full-time engineer (@hexonaut) to this initiative, PECU will support innovation and growth, which is crucial for the long-term success of MakerDAO. This initiative seeks to draw innovation to the periphery of MakerDAO, which will help to create a more robust and decentralized financial system. We move to support.

content.content: Executive Vote  Emergency Parameter Changes - March 11, 2023 What will go down as a memorable weekend of uncertainty and traumatic stress, largely due to previous defaults caused by under-collateral instruments that had a devastating impact on the ecosystem, this Emergency Executive is taking the necessary precautions to safeguard Maker and DAI. The DeFi community, along with the MakerDAO community, will learn from this experience that relying on one (1) collateral type is not prudent risk management. Although we all understand this, it is often overlooked as we assume others are more astute than ourselves, when in reality, they are not. This experience will be a valuable lesson in Maker’s history and serves as a reminder that the protocol must always aim to be self-sufficient, self-reliant and forever decentralized. We cannot depend on the autonomy of a Central Bank that is “data dependent” and is no longer in touch with reality. We must strive to do better. Thank you to all the teams involved overnight, day and morning to get this Executive to a vote. You are deeply appreciated.  Forever MakerDAO. We move to SUPPORT.

Active Polls 4 POLLS - ENDING MAR 16 2023 16:00 UTC  Remove the DC-IAM from MIP65 (RWA007-A) - March 13, 2023 The original “Request to Poll” has ask Maker Governance to increase the Debt Ceiling (DC) for MakerDAO’s MIP65 by 750 million to 1.25 billion, in order to deploy a 6-month US Treasury ladder strategy with a bi-weekly roll-over. The strategy involves purchasing US Treasuries with maturities equally split over 6 months, so that bi-weekly, a similar amount of US Treasuries mature. The net yield generated will be transmitted to the Surplus Buffer, and if the actual assets held under MIP65 are more than 50 million USD above the proposed MIP105 Asset Allocation Number for Viridian. Assets will be paid into the MIP65 Vault. If the actual assets are more than 50 million USD below this number and the MIP65 Debt Ceiling is not fully utilized, a draw on the Debt Ceiling will be made. Therefore POLL ID 981 is asking to remove the DC-IAM and this would enable the DAO to deploy the additional 750 million USD more quickly into the proposed US Treasury ladder strategy over a 1-week period, as oppose to 8-weeks. We believe this removes the bureaucracy of FINALLY moving the USDC in the PSM and putting such assets to finally provide yield for MakerDAO. It’s also refreshing to see MIP65 using Switzerland based bank Sygnum. We move to support and Vote YES.  Increase the MIP65 (RWA007-A) Debt Ceiling - March 13, 2023 We believe that diversifying the risks of USDC via MIP65 can be beneficial for the further growth of the ecosystem. As mentioned above, this proposed strategy involves purchasing short-duration US Treasuries, which can provide a low-risk opportunity for the DAO and generate yields that can be directed to the Surplus Buffer. Additionally, the proposal has been made after considering the financial sustainability of the Maker Protocol, which is essential for long-term growth. We move to support and vote YES.  Short Ratification Poll for Vault Setting Amendment Subproposal (MIP92c5-SP1) - March 13, 2023 This is a proposal that could have used the opinion of Risk CU, as perhaps even the authors of MIP92, which is Yearn Finance and their thoughts on such. Unfortunately with everything that is being proposed and built, it was lost in translation and no feedback was provided. We then believe that the proposed dynamics of the Endgame Constitution push these types of proposals to Creator SubDAOs. Therefore we believe a platform like Spark Lend  and others alike, can use such a strategy and ask the author to propose it to the Creator SubDAO communities that will develop in the near-term. We move to Poll NO.  Return Excess MIP65 Funds to Surplus Buffer - March 13, 2023 Voted YES as it is good to see MIP65 pay back Dividends to the DAO. This is the original intention and we are satisfied so far with the results as we closely monitor the current liquidity crisis across the American financial system. We are stoked to see the excessive amount of USDC in the PSM to finally be put to work.
