content.content: Active Polls 18 POLLS - ENDING MAR 27 2023 16:00 UTC  Ratification Poll for the Constitution MIP Set - March 13, 2023 Voted YES to the entirety of the Constitution MIP Set – We believe that the the Maker Constitution is a much needed set of rules and guidelines that govern the operations and decision-making processes of the MakerDAO. The Maker Constitution was developed to establish a framework for decision-making that reflects the principles of transparency, accountability, and community governance. Flip Flop Flap Delegate LLC will always support transparency and the establishment of a community-driven governance system with the use of on-chain governance via the Governance token MKR to facilitate decision-making and incentivize participation. The Maker Constitution not only provides openness and transparency among its DAO members, but it also encourages the public good of giving back for the betterment of humanity. We cannot think of a better opportunity than to finally showcase the goodness that this beautiful technology can provide to the world. Under the Maker Constitution, a portion of the revenue generated by the protocol is set aside for the Public Goods Fund, which is used to support projects that are proposed and approved by the MakerDAO community through a decentralized governance process. We believe that not only does the constitution reinforce a healthy growth of community alignment, but it can also solidify DAI as a stablecoin that has a public good purpose at the core of the project–going beyond simple financial gain. The MakerDAO project’s commitment to supporting public goods and fostering a decentralized governance model reflects a broader mission to promote the development and growth of the Ethereum ecosystem as a whole. By positioning DAI as a stablecoin that is not only transparent and resilient but also supports the broader public good, the MakerDAO project has the potential to differentiate itself from other stablecoins and build a strong and loyal user base that shares its values and mission. With regards to the The Scope Frameworks, although not fully completed (work-in-progress that anybody can and should contribute to), we believe that they provide a set of guidelines and principles for how DAO decisions should be made, including criteria for determining which types of proposals are within the scope of the MakerDAO’s governance process, how proposals should be evaluated and prioritized, and how decisions should be implemented and enforced. By providing this framework, the Scope Frameworks help to ensure that the MakerDAO operates in a transparent, accountable, and effective manner, and that its decisions are aligned with the interests of its community of stakeholders. They are therefore a crucial component of the Maker Constitution. And last but not least, we believe the Endgame Ecosystems will empower the workforce and the community. By allowing people to be innovative it will reduce friction and increase alignment, turning a zero-sum game into a joint-effort to create value for the greater good of the DAO. It is impossible to engineer a complex system from the top down. It has to emerge from an iterative process of imagination, experimentation, and learning. The Maker Constitution encourages the community to be self-employed and become entrepreneurs because people are not a means to an end but an end in themselves.  Ratification Poll for Onboarding Retro as CES-001 Facilitator (MIP41c4-SP40) - March 13, 2023 Since attending the ETHGathering in Barcelona in November, 2022–we have seen Retro work relentlessly on helping the community understand the proposed Endgame. He also filled in a gap left at CES-001 and has deliver the principles of a facilitator. These qualities include neutrality, respect, acknowledging the wisdom of the other CES team members, and superb analytical skills. We move to support this Poll and Vote YES.  Ratification Poll for Phoenix Labs - Spark Lend Launch (SPF) (MIP55c3-SP16) - March 13, 2023 Voted YES – This is perhaps one of the most exciting announcements this DAO has made since the inception of Multi-Collateral DAI (MCD). The goal of Spark Lend is to provide additional liquidity to the MakerDAO ecosystem by allowing users to borrow and lend a wider range of assets than are currently supported by Maker. Under the proposal, Spark Lend will use DAI as its primary borrowing and lending asset, but would also support a variety of other collateral types, such as ETH, BTC, and other ERC-20 tokens. We believe in the current market environment it is necessary to offer the world options for the opportunity to retain self-custody of their assets. And Spark Lend can provide one of many options available in the DeFi ecosystem. The launch of this platform helps the entire ecosystem, as well as the greater good of people who are desperate to liberate themselves from the failures caused by irresponsible financial market decisions of others.  Ratification Poll for D3M to Spark Lend (MIP116) - March 13, 2023 Voted YES – as stated above, Spark Lend will use DAI as its primary borrowing and lending asset, but would also support a variety of other collateral types, such as ETH, BTC, and other ERC-20 tokens. Although we are supportive of Spark lend and for the use of the D3M, we believe that it will be difficult task to scale this platform above $200M. Therefore, we are confident that growth and usage of the D3M will be used in a conservative manner–because users these days need to regain confidence in DeFi. We believe that the max line of 200M DAI will not be reached in 2023. We are also confident that the gap of 50M DAI is a good start and we’ll be surprised if it reaches 100M by EOY.  We hope to be proven wrong.  Ratification Poll for Expand Facilitator Definition to Allow Entities (MIP4c2-SP34) - March 13, 2023 Voted YES – we believe it is prudent for MKR token owners to allow facilitators to be redefined from “individuals” to “authorized accounts". We fully support.  Ratification Poll for Risk Facilitator Onboarding (RISK-001) (MIP41c4-SP41) - March 13, 2023 Voted YES – The Maker community is a very lucky community. After losing the former Risk-CU facilitator, Primoz–we are now lucky to have the services available of both Rema and MonetSupply. Not only are we lucky, these two individuals along with the rest of their teammates held our hands through the Weekend crisis of Silicon Valley Bank. I can’t think of 2 more qualified individuals that will try their best to keep Maker safe. We support them wholeheartedly and know that they’ll be here, ready, willing, and able for the benefit of MakerDAO.  Ratification Poll for Protocol Engineering Facilitator Onboarding (MIP41c4-SP42) - March 13, 2023 Voted YES – Yet another amazing onboarding of PECU’s Protech Labs. One of the best qualified facilitators in the entire crypto ecosystem, Derek is the voice of Protech Labs and we believe this is a wonderful on-boarding.  Ratification Poll for Starknet CU Budget Extension (SNE-001) (MIP14c2-SP4) - March 13, 2023 Voted YES – although this Poll might be superseded if MKR token owners approved the current Maker Constitution MIP Set proposal (MIP102c2-SP1), we believe StarkNet CU should have a budget extension until June, 2023 and will then adopt as an Ecosystem Actor.  Ratification Poll for Requesting Protocol DAI Transfer to fund TechOps CU for March 2023 (MIP14c2-SP5) - March 13, 2023 Voted YES – although this Poll might be superseded if MKR token owners approved the current Maker Constitution MIP Set proposal(MIP102c2-SP1), we believe TechOps CU should have a budget extension for March, 2023 and will then adopt as an Ecosystem Actor. Much needed CU in the Maker ecosystem.  Ratification Poll for Modifying Sidestream Auction Services Core Unit Mandate - SAS-001 (MIP39c2-SP39) - March 13, 2023 Voted YES – although this Poll might be superseded if MKR token owners approved the current Maker Constitution MIP Set proposal(MIP102c2-SP1), we believe SAS-CU plays very well in the Endgame sandbox. This team is super talented and can help out in many ways when it comes to engineering tasks related to the Endgame.  Budget Ratification Poll for TechOps Core Unit DAI Budget (MIP40c3-SP88) - March 13, 2023 1st Rank Choice: Approve NewBear budget - 1,368,924 DAI As Stated Above,  although this Budget Poll request  might be superseded if MKR token owners approved the current Maker Constitution MIP Set proposal(MIP102c2-SP1), we believe TechOps CU is a much needed CU in the Maker ecosystem. Unfortunately the current market conditions call for a “bear budget.”  Ratification Poll for Modify Core Unit Budget (DECO-001) (MIP40c3-SP89) - March 13, 2023 Voted NO – The recent markets events have made us realized that there is a need for “Term-DAI” and there’s no other team that has had the time and already built DssGate as it’s primary module to implement such an initiative if MKR token owners decide to go this route. We also believe the talent available in Deco can be used to outsource their talents as resources for the development of the Endgame ecosystem. And that can be define as simply helping build a front-ent for a cluster, or finally sailing this ship into a decentralized IPFS front-end. We believe the team at Deco can deliver. Yes, the community has waited for a fixed rates platform to finally come into fruition, but building out, testing, fuzzing DssGate cannot happen in 25 days. Let’s be realistic and allow this platform to slowly build out and deliver.  Budget Ratification Poll for GovAlpha Core Unit DAI Budget 2023-2024 (MIP40c3-SP90) - March 13, 2023 1st Rank Choice: Approve BasePlus budget - 904,805 DAI 2nd  Rank Choice: Approve Base budget - 805,805 DAI Although this Poll might be superseded if MKR token owners approved the current Maker Constitution MIP Set proposal(MIP102c2-SP1), we believe GovAlpha is one of the most important components of Maker Governance. The team works day & night to keep the protocol transparent, following guidelines, and they make sure principles of decentralized governance are always in tact. We believe they deserve a BasePlus budget for their dedication and commitment to the MakerDAO community.  Budget Ratification Poll for GovAlpha Core Unit MKR Budget Q2 2023 (MIP40c3-SP91) - March 13, 2023 As stated above  Although this Poll might be superseded if MKR token owners approved the current Maker Constitution MIP Set proposal(MIP102c2-SP1), we believe GovAlpha is one of the most important components of Maker Governance.  Ratification Poll for Modify Risk Core Unit Budget (RISK-001) (MIP40c3-SP92) - March 13, 2023 1st Rank Choice: Approve reduced budget - 2,484,000 DAI Although this Budget Poll request  might be superseded if MKR token owners approved the current Maker Constitution MIP Set proposal(MIP102c2-SP1), we believe Risk CU is a much needed and important CU in the Maker ecosystem. Unfortunately the current market conditions call for a “reduced budget.”  Budget Ratification Poll for Modifying Strategic Finance Core Unit Budget, SF-001 (MIP40c3-SP93) - March 13, 2023 1st Rank Choice: Approve Bear budget - 1,981,140 DAI Although this Budget Poll request  might be superseded if MKR token owners approved the current Maker Constitution MIP Set proposal(MIP102c2-SP1), we believe SF-CU is a much needed CU in the Maker ecosystem. Unfortunately the current market conditions call for a “bear budget.”  Ratification Poll for Modify Data Insights Core Unit Budget (DIN-001) (MIP40c3-SP96) - March 13, 2023 1st Rank Choice: Approve reduced budget - 972,000.90 DAI Although this Budget Poll request  might be superseded if MKR token owners approved the current Maker Constitution MIP Set proposal(MIP102c2-SP1), we believe DIN-CU plays well as an ecosystem actor and should already be thinking about branching out. Unfortunately the current market conditions call for a “reduced budget.”  Budget Ratification Poll for Modifying Sidestream Auction Services Core Unit Budget (SAS-001) (MIP40c3-SP95) - March 13, 2023 1st Rank Choice: Approve reduced budget - 850,950 DAI Although this Budget Poll request  might be superseded if MKR token owners approved the current Maker Constitution MIP Set proposal(MIP102c2-SP1), we believe SAS-CU plays well as an ecosystem actor and should already be thinking about branching out. Unfortunately the current market conditions call for a “reduced budget.”

content.content: Emergency Executive Proposal  Emergency PSM Changes – March 14, 2023 Flip Flop Flap Delegate LLC voted to SUPPORT the incorporation of a Debt Ceiling Breaker that allows Governance to bypass the GSM Pause Delay for the USDC-A, PAX-A, and GUSD-A Peg Stability Modules. This move is a temporary measure, commonly utilized by major financial markets worldwide, and ought to have been implemented beforehand to mitigate the recent market turbulence caused by the regional bank liquidity crisis of 2023. It is our belief that the majority of the community supports this proposal, as reliance on Centralized Governments’ decision-making over the past weekend should not be a dependency for a DeFi protocol.

content.content: Active Polls 2 POLLS - ENDING MAR 23 2023 16:00 UTC  PSM Parameter Normalization - March 20, 2023 1ST CHOICE AND ONLY CHOICE Option 2 - Maintain USDC as the Primary Reserve Flip Flop Flap Delegate LLC believes that Maker can now revert back to a tin of 0% and USDC should be the  primary focus if the DAO wants to continue accumulating centralized stablecoins. No need to divert to a second tier stablecoin that is struggling to find PMF.  Short Ratification Poll for RWA Foundation Broker Onboarding & Expensing for Professional Services (MIP58c4-SP1) - March 20, 2023 Flip Flop Flap Delegate LLC fully supports the engagement of Ogier for legal services and adding an accounting firm that is qualified to provide accounting services for the RWA Foundation.
